description:
We wanted to grab a quick bite before our event at the Curran Theatre and stumbled upon Pinecrest Diner.  Their menu is full of standard diner fare for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  I ordered a chicken caesar salad.  WOW!  It was almost more beautifully grilled chicken than crisp, fresh Romaine lettuce.  Just the right amount of parmesan cheese and dressing.  I'm very particular when it comes to my caesar salads.  I wont eat the 'old' dark green romaine tops, because Yuck!  This salad had none of that!  It was Delicious!  I was tempted to look at their dessert menu, but I didn't want to be late to the Curran, which is just up the block from Pinecrest.  Maybe next time!

If you're in the area, don't pass up Pinecrest Diner because it's not the upscale place you were hoping to find.  The food is GOOD!  And to think I almost settled for the Jack in the Box across the street.  Thank goodness I didn't!!
author: Abby L.

description:
I worked the Salesforce dreamfesr yesterday, Metallica played & it was freaking amazing. Didn't got out until 2am and I was starving. Ubered over to the Pinecrest in which I haven't been in years. Long wait but totally ty normal for how crazy busy they were. 
I had the chicken and waffles
OMG BECKY! A 1/2 a chicken and big waffles. I took it home all the way across town and when I opened it up it was still crunchy crunchy. Extremely tastey and still fantastic when I woke to eat it the next day
author: Enilda R.

description:
I had come a year ago and had good memories of the place after having a scrumptious omelette. 
Went here for lunch today though, and was utterly disappointed. I had an egg white bay shrimp omelette which was pepperjack cheese, green onions, tomatoes and shrimp. This was probably one of the worst omelettes I've had in my life. It was so tasteless, probably didn't even have salt and pepper. The shrimp was very plainly cooked, and they could hardly be tasted, while the taste of the tomatoes was just overwhelming. The cheese (which didn't really taste like good pepperjack either) was very unevenly distributed with large blobs of it in some places and absolutely nothing in others. The combination of these fillings was a very bad idea. I should have just gone for a plain ham and cheese. They were willing to sub the hash browns and toast for a side salad, so that was nice.
My boyfriend had the pinecrest special with french toast, and he said it was nice, but the portion size was a bit small.
author: Haylee M.

description: Still my go to diner. Omg this time I ordered the Pasta Carbonara with chicken and it was so creamy and so tasty. Even the bread was toasty and buttered. How does this place have less than 4 stars??? That blows my mind. The food is pretty good here so I'm very confused. Our server was also super friendly. This place is affordable and good. You can't beat it!
author: Allyson L.

description: We were here twice in the past two days. Yesterday we both had oatmeal with sliced bananas - decent. Today we shared the large fresh fruits and cottage cheese (photo below of my 1/2 portion ... after I mixed them together). Very large blueberries, decent strawberries, bananas and blackberries just right. Of course, there was cantalope and honeydew, but they were nothing to write about. Only $12 for the two of us. It's on the corner of Geary & Mason Streets (close to Union Square). It was crowded both times, seems like a popular local place, and it's next to about a half dozen art galleries ... which is why we were there. On the downside, their bathrooms were down a few grey flights of slippery stairs in the dungeon ... when I got back to our booth and my wife told me she had to go too, I suggested she wait until we walked back to the hotel.
author: Aba H.

description:
A wonderful place to stumble into after having a few drinks nearby!!  Place is open 24 hours, and the menu has something for everyone!

I seized the opportunity to enjoy a plate of chicken and waffles as soon as I saw it on the menu. My group ordered a whole bunch of other breakfast items too. My food was delicious!  The garlic fries were also   perfectly crispy and garlicky.

The waitress was even able to ring each person up in our group separately, since we all needed individual receipts (business trip).
author: Jay Z.

description: They advertise "The Best Breakfast in San Francisco".  Close, but no cigar.  I went with the kids and we each had eggs (scrambled) with hash and toast.  The eggs were good, the meats (bacon and sausage) were cooked well, but the hash was a little too oily and maybe not crispy enough.  Service was friendly, but a little slow.  The prices were reasonable (comparable with Denny's), maybe that's why there was a line out the door.  Good place, just not great.  They're open 24 hrs, so would be a good option at 3AM.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Diners rule! In my many moons on the planet,since traveling on the road with my family as a child - diners have never failed me.  I feel I need to do an exclusive diner review. This place has now made my extensive list of diner experiences and I am happy to say it's near the top!

Up the street from our hotel, we kept passing Pinecrest on our walking tours of the streets of San Francisco. And every time - the lines were out the door and down the block! We knew we had to come here and were trying to figure out WHEN. When is this place NOT crowded? 

I wrote in another review about a serendipitous experience Mr. E had (subject of the other review) after stopping in and ordering charbroiled burgers to go from a diner (this review).  This place is 11 on the scale of  1 to10!  And this, from two charbroiled cheeseburgers, lettuce, pickle, tomato, on a bun with NO other condiments! I declare I have not had a better grilled burger ANYWHERE - not even at a summer cookout! We devoured these burgers late at night in our hotel room - an unusual late night snack for us, but OH did it satisfy!! Upset after the burgers were all gone; we knew we had to go back for a proper meal.

On our last day, after checking out of the hotel in the wee hours, we sat down for our final meal in San Francisco (no lines at this time of morning, btw). I had my tried and true two eggs over easy, chicken sausages, hash brown potatoes, wheat toast and regular coffee. Mr. E had pancakes, corned beef hash and decaf coffee.  Again, big ups for the west coast's now unbroken record for the best coffee we've had consistently.

When we visit San Francisco again, we will come back here and try some of the other delectable offerings on their menu. Diners rule!
author: Bridget E.

description:
You cant go wrong with the Ruben, it will melt in your mouth, with their homemade thousand island dressing, I could only eat half of my sandwich as it was to big, it would be a good sandwich to share.
HAPPY EATING
author: Jill B.

description: This place was goooood! Like dayumn! Had to wait in line for 15 minutes but it was totally worth it. This is the type of diner I've been waiting to go to! I wanted to order everything on the menu. Bummer I was only in this part of San Fran for one day but the Reuben was absolutely delicious. So savory and mouthwatering. The service was very prompt and attentive for the amount of guests at the time. My experience was near perfect
author: Maurice C.

description: Came here late night excited for the number of options Pinecrest offered and left very disappointed. While it was busy, the place was not overflowing. It still took over 20 minutes just to put in an order for a root beer float. The staff seemed overworked and were unfriendly. After an additional 15 minutes of waiting and being told impatiently by staff to wait for someone to take our food order, we paid for our overpriced root beer float and left to try a place better able to serve their customers.
author: Evan P.

description:
Charged me $8.95 for sweet potato fries!!! There is not even any parmesan or anything on them. And their menu on Google says they're $4.75...but the cashier acted like she knew what she was talking about when she said $8.95. That is more than what the nachos cost, the Chili Bowl, and plenty of other things. Absurd. I even looked up to see if sweet potato prices had surged and they actually went down as of a few months ago, so it makes no sense at all. Would post pictures if this form would let me.

P.S. Just looked up their online menu and it says $7.95...still ridiculous but $1 less than she charged me. What a ripoff. The Melt's sweet potato fries actually have some effort put into them and are delicious.
author: karisma r.

description: Often filled with tourists, but an authentic neighborhood go-to, especially for comfort food.  Great reliable diner at all hours.
author: Debby W.

description: I should have gone with yelp but my colleagues wanted to eat here so I decided to join. First and foremost I don't care how bad you have to use the restroom NOT HERE I REPEAT NOT HERE! That should have been my second clue (don't eat here). So I ordered grilled cheese and it looked nothing like the picture. I could make that at home!!!!!!!!
author: Mane S.

description:
At 2am everything tastes wonderful and so does this place ;-)) It's probably the only time I have ended up here for a greasy breakfast, nachos, burgers and so on. I don't think I have set foot in here during daytime ;-)) 

I like diners and they are a pleasure after a long night out with friends. I like the nachos here and they load it up pretty good. They are quick, efficient and get you out as soon as possible. 

I will end up here again for sure. It happens every time I am in SF ;-)) It's good value for money and quick to get a nice variety of food late at night.
author: Sam S.

description:
Pinecrest came through and saved the day, curing our late night hunger pangs. There's nothing better than a diner open late. And if you're hitting the diner after midnight, that means you need to get breakfast, right?

I went for the classic eggs over easy with sourdough toast, sausage and hash browns. Everything was great! The sourdough toast is standout - carbs are life. Also, SF sourdough is the best sourdough. Fact. The portion was huge too - 4 halves of toast, 2 eggs, half a plate full of hash browns, and 4 sausage links. Definitely ate it all. *clean plate club*

The burger my friend had was delish too - charbroiled on the grill with a sesame seed bun. Classic and simple. Also, surprisingly the bacon Mac and cheese was bomb! The cheese sauce was well made and had that tangy cheddar thing going on. 

Definitely worth it for a late night stop! I also heard there's some history to the place making it a good SF experience.
author: Breanna B.

description: We were super hungry on our first morning in San Francisco and decided to go with a basic Diner, and this was right near our hotel. We were super glad we found this place! There was a short line (which also made it seem like a place well liked) but it went pretty fast and the food was really quite good. We were very pleasantly surprised at this Diner that doesn't look like much from the outside, but the food was quality and delicious and honestly better than your typical diner.
author: Becky T.

description:
3 years later and Pinecrest Diner earns an additional star from me! Same scenario... late night eats after a night out at the bar, but a much better foodie experience this go-around.

I'm almost embarrassed to admit my order, but sometimes you just have to go with your gut (literally) and indulge. So, that being said... I ordered the bacon mac and cheese with a pancake on the side. That's right, you read correctly. Mac and cheese with a side pancake. #YOLO.

Luckily, calories don't count when you're traveling (right?) so I have no shame in saying that this bacon mac and cheese was delightful. It was sooo cheesy with the cheese melted in and sprinkled on the top and had just the right amount of bacon in it. Plus, it oddly came with a side of buttered toast which was weird, but I didn't mind it since my stomach could use some extra carbs to soak up my beverages. The pancake was pretty standard but the perfect sweet to my savory.

My last experience here was a win in my eyes. Gotta appreciate those late night food spots! Plus, pancakes are the trendy new night cap... didn't you know?

Okay, I made that up. Not a bad idea though, am I right? ;)
author: Jacqueline B.

description: There are so few 24-hour dining options left in SF, so it's nice to have this classic diner still in the game. Totally serviceable breakfast, a very good chicken-and-waffle option, and sandwiches/blue plates/ mozzarella sticks, etc., to soak up alcohol. Counter or booth seating and proficient service. Centrally located at the edge of the TL by union square.
author: Sharon L.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Friday while waiting to be able to check into our hotel. We got seated immediately and the service was excellent.

I had a bacon burger and it was quite excellent. The meat was cooked just the way I wanted and the bacon was very crisp.

Be warned the bathroom here (if you have to go) is down a hallway, down some steps, down another hallway, down some more steps and then down another hallway. I wasn't sure if I was headed to the bathroom or to Narnia!
author: Jason J.

description:
I was walking around late on a Saturday with a hungry friend. We wanted a relatively quiet place with quick service. Yes, it's a diner, and you get what you are expecting, but diners are a quintessential late night experience. I had a good cup of coffee and the chicken rice soup of the day, resisting a broad array of deliciously greasy temptations.

The food came out quickly and was enjoyable. Service was quick with drinks but slow to take our order. To me, that was fine because I wanted to talk to my friend and enjoy the ambiance.
author: Joshua W.

description:
I ordered Bacon & Avocado cheeseburger. It looked delicious. I told them well done for the burger but it came back medium to rare, hard on outside. (See photos)

In addion to that, bacon was thick, and Burger was big, but both were dry, so 
I'd rather have more crispy but juicy bacon, and moist burger with thick tasty fries.

Otherwise it's typical good American dinner and pretty good portion.
author: Mut M.

description: Ive been here multiple times after a night out and overtime I've been here its been packed however Ive always gotten seat within 5-10 mins..... not too bad. Now let me just say this the food is good but its not to die for BUUUTTTTT! if you are hungry and its 1am this place will do! The onion rings are one of my fav dhishes and the Blt is also really good. I definitely  will be coming back here any time I want a late night bite. Check it out for yourself!
author: Eva B.

description:
Lived in the TL for 3 years and only came here for the first time two weeks prior!  How i wish i could turn back time?   I highly recommend getting breakfast because theirs is on point!
So far everything I've had has been too good to stop eating even tho i was extremely and totally full.  
Usually pretty easy to grab a seat late night other than just after 2am when the bars close
author: Lawrence W.

description: Atmosphere was the star here.  it's 3 star food, but I'm adding 2 for the Russian waitress with the awesome accent.  She was hardworking and put up with my attempt at joking around and conversation.  I had the oatmeal and its is hard to screw up oatmeal.  Included is, cinnamon, raisins, brown sugar, bananas and milk, so you can make it to your liking.  Did I mention the Russian waitress.
author: Mike D.

description: I waited at the counter for 15 minutes Friday night and I wasn't even acknowledged.There was at least 3-4 employees that walked by me and no service. My boyfriend and I left went to Cafe Mason where we got prompt service.
author: Mo L.

description: Great food, large portions. Never had much trouble getting a table, even on the weekends for brunch.
author: Angela M.

description: Last week 6am day doesn't really matter I had the munchies. I can only think of a cheeseburger fries and shake. The gentlemen I'm seeing suggested this place. I made a couple rookie mistakes. I always order my French fries well done. I assumed they were going to serve me steak fries. I was disappointed when I was served crunchy shoe string fries. You are a diner act as such. Leave the skinny fries to McDonald's. Overall food was decent. Server not warm at all. Next morning same time the gentlemen I'm seeing escorted me back there. ( ladies don't give up hope...there are still good men out there:) we ordered turkey burgers with Swiss fries...I had a chocolate shake. It seemed like he wanted my shake so bad. Same server he lacks warmth I guess that's his thing. He more then makes up for it with excellent service if that makes any since. Hipsters where did they come from. So the momentum was so good we went back a third morning. This time we ordered traditional breakfast food. We both got the namesake special. Delicious. The server looked like she didn't understand that 90s grudge is over! We are eating there tomorrow if it's in the cards. Hopefully someone reads this in management and politely demands her to wash her hair  wax and wear a little makeup. These are facts no shade intended. I just don't want to get sick from someone's bad hygiene. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice meal with an atmosphere geared for footsie and intimate conversation
author: Terina C.

description:
American sized breakfast!
Corned beef hash with 2 eggs ($12.95 USD) and House Omelet ($11.95 USD)
The corned beef hash was good, double the hash since it comes with the hasbrowns as well. Loved the hash, especially the burnt parts cause it was extra crispy. The house omelet came with mushrooms, tomatoes and cheese. The egg was still quite runny so wasn't much of an omelet imo, more like just scrambled eggs. I really wonder how many eggs they used to make this omelet tho!

Best part is, it's 24 hours!
author: Debbie P.

description: This is a GREAT greasy-spoon diner. There are not many of these gems left in major metros and it's my late-night SFO jam. No nonsense service, food delivered quickly and killer omelettes. I wish I had one in MSP rather than the breakfast chains that are getting way to classy and expensive. Don't sell out Pinecrest!
author: Steven D.

description: Great place to eat! Get the sourdough toast! It's fantastic! I had the Spanish omelet and my husband had the continental omelet. They served us HUGE plates of food! It's was very good! Great waitstaff, very attentive! We walked by at one in the morning and it was still packed! Great diner!
author: Jackie I.

description: We were in town and wanted a place for a quick, good breakfast.  We asked at our hotel and they sent us to the Pinecrest Diner.  Ironically we had seen it the day before and thought it would be a good place for breakfast.  I had the corned beef n hash and although it looked messy, it was delicious!  For some reason the english muffin there was amazing!  My wife had the eggs benedict and was very happy with it.  This is a great quick service, old school diner type of establishment.  It's not the cleanist, newest, nicest place around but it's a great no frills breakfast place with quality food where you can be served quickly and be on your way!  Very friendly staff from the bussers to the waitress to the guy at the register that rings you up.  We'd go back!
author: Jeff G.

description:
Every time I'm in downtown SFO, I get quite the appetite from dodging panhandlers and head to Lefty O'Douls for some comfort food, but alas it has been shuttered, wtf. 

I kept walking and just as I was about to turn around I saw Pinecrest Diner sign and that was enough for me.

Good choice, good food, good location and good times.
author: John F.

description:
We found the Pinecrest Diner on Yelp! We were looking for a place close to our hotel because it was raining, and this restaurant was only a block away. Great place to eat on a Monday night.

The service was efficient, the place was clean and the food was good. I had a hard time deciding what to order from their extensive menu and finally decided on the Cobb Salad. I was not disappointed...it was delicious!
author: Diana W.

description:
I'd just gotten back to the states after a month in Asia with my partner. We needed some traditional American diner food, and boy oh boy did they deliver. 

We sat at the bar, split some buffalo wings, a chicken Cobb salad, and the best country fried steak and eggs I've had in recent memory.

If it wasn't 2 am, we'd have been guzzling what smelled like yummy diner coffee as well. 

The service was great, friendly staff sat near us with the USA vs Mexico women's soccer qualifier on. Will be back, feels like a once a month spot.
author: Ryan B.

description:
During our first night in SF, we went to check into Hotel Epik and decided we wanted to have a last meal before heading to bed. We looked up 24 hr food since it was after midnight and thought this place would be a perfect fit.

If this scenario sounds like your current situation, don't follow what we did, which was walk from Hotel Epik to this restaurant... 15 min doesn't sound too bad right? WRONG. Maybe it's because I'm not from here, but the walk from our hotel to this place was super unpleasant...trash and bums everywhere, people yelling and threatening us..they could tell us two girls weren't locals. TAKE A CAR, UBER OR TAXI if you aren't comfortable in these situations.

But literally when you turn the corner to this restaurant, the vibe went back to relaxed and safe it was surprising 

Now on to the good stuff. The food! I really enjoyed my pesto chicken sandwich with fries and my friend's mac and cheese was really delicious. Her mac n cheese came with shredded cheese that eventually melted so perfectly. I recommend both meals 

The place itself was pretty packed during around 1am... mostly people who looked like they just came back from drinking. No wait this time though 

The service was just okay. We were in a booth in the corner by the entrance and we felt like the server forgot about us. Either because they were busy or we were kinda tucked away from his view... or a combination of both. Even the table next to us had the same service, asking us how long it took us to get the guy to talk to us. When the server did come around, he was really friendly 

Took a taxi back home because we felt like our lives were worth a $5 ride at 2-3am
author: Deanne L.

description: Horrible diner.  I walked in and was not acknowledge until I approached them for a table. They made a mistake with my order and totally forgot to give me eggs. I reminded two waiters that I have not received my eggs and they just blew me off. We asked several times for our check but they didn't bother on acknowledging us. Worst diner experience ever.
author: Mark A.

description: Good diner food. The service is what got me. It was a busy Saturday evening and they served us quickly and they were very accommodating.
author: David R.

description: Come to san fran once a year to hang out. Every year everything I get here is amazing!! 24 hours aswell, cant beat that!
author: Micah M.

description: It's diner food for sure, nothing special or awful. Just really slow service. Convenient location and the staff is friendly.
author: Lovely L.

description: After a night of drinking my friends and I came to this diner STARVING! Our waitress took our order quickly and answered any questions that we had. Our food came out fast and was delicious! This was the perfect place to come to get something to eat after a night out. Prices are somewhat average, would def. come here again.
author: Crisia S.

description: I have been coming to the Pinecrest for more than 12 years.  You get what you pay for and here you get great food.  Always fresh and beautifully prepared.  A great diner.
author: Marc P.

description: True, great, old school dinner experience. The best place to have 24hr steak and eggs "breakfast" after hitting the bars or when you've travelled to SF from another continent and the jet lag is killing you. Skip Dennis, Mel's and all the other ones, Pinecrest is A LOT better.
author: Ioannis K.

description:
Location: One block from Union Square. Great location. Small dinner with large booths.

Service: Fast and friendly service.

Food: Great breakfast! We came here two days in a row so far. Hashbrowns were buttery and nicely toasted. Eggs were yummy and buttery. Sausage, hot link and bacon were nicely grilled, great flavors. Pancakes were sooo good.

Prices: Reasonable for the area.

We will be back again.
author: Linda H.

description: Horrible manager! He refused me to sit at booth even though not busy. I explained I have a disability and need for my feet to touch the ground. He refused and forced my out of the restaurant. Actually escorted me out tells my me I should know better after I told I told him I've been coming there for over twenty years. Very hurtful!
author: John M.

description:
Let me start off my saying this place is really small! It may seat 50 people at most! 

There's not a designated waiting area so you may be waiting outside and this morning, it was really cold. We got stuck at a table right in front of door. People were coming in and out and holding the door wide open so, I felt like we were eating outside. 

Wait staff were moving fast and seemed overwhelmed. Food wasn't that great. Mainly the french toast...it appeared to be overcooked. 

I'll pass next time!
author: Pam T.

description: I've been here about 10 times now and have not had a bad meal. And the small stuff matters! Bill, the owner who I have recently found out is 91 is sitting at the counter regularly. It takes everything in me not to squeeze him every time I see him. We were in the other day and Pete, his son (owner), stopped on his way out and introduced himself and chatted for a bit. Nice people, good food! My new favorite is the Patty Melt. Yuuuuum!
author: Ruth M.

description: Great diner.  Lots of choices.  Service was terrific.  It is a long bowling alley of a seating area, but it seats quite a bit.  They are attentive.  Bathrooms are way downstairs and a bit of hike.
author: Jessica J.

description:
We are visiting the city for a week, but staying about 30 minutes away.  Most days we're here early so we're looking for a good breakfast place.

The overall rating gave this diner 3.5 stars, but please read the individual reviews because it definitely is wayyy better than 3.5 stars!

From the minute we stepped inside the staff are very welcoming.  There were quite a few tables open and for our party of 3 we were told we could pick anywhere to sit.

Coffee is good, strong, and plenty of half and half available on the table.  Ask for more once you've blown through it.

I ordered the hash and two eggs, which also came with potatoes and toast (which had a generous amount of butter - yum!).

Everything was hot and freshly made.

Cash of course, is accepted.  If you pay by credit/debit card, you need to show a valid ID.

Overall, I would definitely come back here!!
author: Cherie D.

description:
Food great.  Service?  Not so much.  Waitress at counter is zero engaging with customers.  Asked cooks twice who to place and order with. She is really good at chatting with coworkers and drinking water (which I had to ask twice for).  Never once asked me how my food was. Put out my credit card. Never said thanks . To me Service is really a major part of the experience.

She just took and order from two separate customers also.  One on my right and on on my left.  Guy next two me asked for a soda twice.  Woman on on my left looked at me after she ordered and said "do you think I'll get my food?  She just walked away.  No thanks your order will be right out, etc"

Customer service not a high mark here.
author: John H.

description:
We loved our time here recently!  I'm not sure how many diners there are in SF, but this one earns great marks for location, service, and great food with us.  Win-Win-Win.

We had the NY steak, which comes with a good size dinner salad, (not wilted, has color to it), a gigantic baked potato, and some seasonal steamed veggies.  (Cauliflower, zucchini, etc)  Everything was really cooked well, no mushy veg, great medium temp steak.  It was enough to share-there was so much to munch on!  (We also ordered an appetizer, which was a mistake, because it was really all too much to eat.  We got the mozzarella sticks-which were awesome- BTW- and they give you 8 per order!)

I had a garden salad, which was a nice sized with the usual veggies.  (I wasn't starving that night, for whatever reason.  I did have a hard time finishing it, it was pretty large for me.  I eat a TON of salads and can usually scarf down quite a bit...so this was a new one!)

The place is a busy little corner, but we got a window booth and it was pretty cool to be right on the sidewalk and peoplewatch while the lights came up in the street.  I like a little hometown feel once and a while, and this place really did feel great.  I know we'll be back again soon!  Thanks, everyone!

TIP:

* There isn't much space to wait and not a ton of tables, so just be aware that they get busy and the line stacks up.

* I saw the nachos and they are HUGE! :)

*They take cards, but have one of those little no name ATM machines inside the door if you need cash...
author: Diana W.

description: I am used to eating places drunk, and as an industry employee, this was the WORST service I have EVER had at any restaurant.  I left $0 tip and told the waitress that.  We waited 20 minutes for waters; had to remind them of our chili, my order was wrong after coming an hour later.  HORRENDOUS.  NEVER AGAIN!
author: N M.

description:
Great spot if you are looking for a diner, fast service, big portions, friendly staff. 
This is a diner & the food is spot on. 
The line moves quickly and there is lots to choose from on the menu.
author: Sara B.

description: We came on 4th of July as they arent very many places open. Waited in 30 min line. Food was good. Service was good. Pancakes were great!!
author: LaTrece J.

description: Good diner food, and reasonable prices (for S.F.). Only negative is that there could be a wait. Luckily, I got a seat at the counter before the morning rush.
author: Michael M.

description: A good fast food option near Union square. You will not leave hungry. Look at the menu before you come in. This is not the place to feel adventurous with food, order the most mainstream dish and avoid disappointment. They will not spend time explaining what they have, but otherwise service was good. If you keep in mind that this is a fast food place, you will be satisfied. When they get your order right (ordering the most mainstream dishes helps here, don't ask for substitutions), food itself will be good.
author: Alex B.

description: Very filling breakfast did come out fast nice little restaurant on the corner Union Square very convenient.
author: Jasmine H.

description: Hot Link, hash browns and eggs - a solid breakfast at 5AM. And that link is nice and spicy.
author: Steve T.

description:
Great all around dinner. 
Open 24/7. One of my favs while in SF
Breakfast served all day
Good coffee
author: Lynn K.

description: Yum! If there is a line, be patient. It's worth the wait!! Excellent corned beef hash!
author: Sheri S.

description:
Nice place!
We saw a huge line in the morning for breakfast and decided to check this diner at lunch - and it was great) awesome meals) breakfast 24 served, everything is delicious
author: Aleksandra K.

description: I love this place so I thought I would come and grab a bite. It was a little busy but the customer should never feel like they are ignored. I stood there waiting for a server for several minutes and no one said I'll be right with you or give me one second. So I walked out.
author: Raquel T.

description:
I came here in June with a friend a few months ago because it was close to our hotel and also had good reviews. The place was clean and definitely had the look of a diner with booths and round seats for sitting at the counter.

My friend and I chose a booth and we got seated right away. Although it was dinner time there were only a couple other customers inside. My friend and I attributed this to the fact that there are a lot of restaurants located in this area, and indeed some more seats started filling in as the evening progressed.

The waiter was really nice and did attend to our table, but he didn't check on us much, which surprised me because there weren't that many people in there. We had to flag him down a couple of times for basic things like water.

The reason for the two stars is because of the rather poor quality of the food.  The waiter said the shrimp on the shrimp salad was boiled but, but he failed to mention that it was also refrigerated and served cold.  My friend ordered the shrimp salad and was disappointed. She didn't finish half of her plate.  My Cobb salad had a few chunks of cheese that I didn't notice until I was almost done with it.  

Since I have a dairy allergy (casein, not lactose intolerant), I was really disappointed to find the cheese and to realize that I may have eaten something that I shouldn't have. I understand that everyone makes mistakes and that if I eat out I have to deal with cross contamination from time to time, but it is always a downer when it happens.

My friend and I plan to visit this area again, but we won't be back to this diner.
author: Jenny T.

description:
We were in San Francisco for a long weekend vacation. We had eaten at very fancy and wanted a quick, enjoyable meal, at a place where a picky 16 year old could find something to eat.

We found this place online and walked over from our hotel. Service was good. All the reasonable meals we had were fresh, tasty and brought out quickly. The portions were huge and we leftover quite a bit since we were leaving in the morning and didn't feel like taking anything back to the hotel with us.

We'd go here again, in a heart beat.
author: Gl R.

description: Loved the diner feel in here. Fast, friendly service! I ordered the shrimp sandwich and it was amazing! Favourite shrimp dish of my San Fran visit. My lunch partner ordered a malt with his burger (which was also real good) had one sip and then accidentally knocked it over. Huge mess. Someone came right over and cleaned it up with basically one wipe. Amazing. Then, they made him a new milkshake free of charge! How sweet is that? Of course we tipped like 35%. Comfy booths, big windows, clean diner vibe and delicious food. Perfect recipe for one happy Lesley.
author: Lesley M.

description:
Absolute best chicken fried steak I've ever had! The diner also had the best hashbrowns, the best coffee, and the best french toast. The prices are a little high, but the food there is worth it. The staff are very nice and give quick, attentive service.
I very rarely give a 5-star review, but this place deserves it. It's a wonderful location if you're staying at the hilton, it's a stroll down the block. Best diner ever!!
author: Colton F.

description:
The diner is about 50 ppl seating. 

There was a wait for about 15 minutes 
Once seated look at the menu and order 

We sat at the bar and got a full view of cooking line

They are extremely packed. Food orders lined up. 

Food is brought out on time 

Had the veggie and Denver omelet 
Everything was really good 9/10 wish they would season the hash browns :( 

Would def come again for breakfast
author: Ruby P.

description:
I come to this diner quite often when in town visiting. One of my favorite late night places to grab a bite to eat. I usually go for the breakfast but there menu is filled with many things such as burgers,salads,appetizers,etc.

Prices may be a tad bit pricey but the portions are a nice size and everything I have ever ordered has turned out yummy so far.
author: Demetria B.

description:
You can get to the Pinecrest diner using SFMTA Route 9 from Pier 41.
The bus will take you to Mason and Geary.  Pinecrest Diner is next to the American Conservatory Theater Box Office.

The food is good, service is outstanding.  Price is reasonable just a block from Union Square.

Let your server know that you have reservations at ACT and they will expedite your order and allow you to be seated before the curtain goes up.
author: Jim Bryant B.

description:
I've walked by this place hundreds of times.  I decided to give it a try last Saturday morning.  

I wanted a solo seat at the counter.  I was told that it would be just a few minutes before I could be seated.  I actually had to wait fifteen minutes.  

I had a craving for a breakfast burrito, but there were none on the menu.  I instead chose a bacon omelette.  My order came up quickly, and I enjoyed the omelette (which actually was more of a scramble) along with has browns and sourdough toast.  

Glad I stopped in.  It is an old-school kind of coffee shop/diner with really good breakfast grub.
author: David W.

description: Stopped in for dinner before heading to the Museum of Ice Cream.   We were seated immediately.  Huge variety on the menu.   We all ordered something different.  I ordered the Belgium Waffles with Strawberries.  Yummmmyyyyy.   My daughter ordered the spaghetti and LOVED it.   We also ordered mac & cheese (made with white cheddar) and it was tasty.
author: Shannon D.

description: Fast service. Great quality. Got invited to join the couple in front of us to join them to save time waiting. Great atmosphere, SOLID diner food. Got the chicken fried steak breakfast - SO good. Gravy was superb and hash browns were crispy yet moist. A great go-to for 24 hour breakfast.
author: Phil P.

description: At first I was a little unsure, but I was quickly rewarded. Very clean and nice atmosphere. Friendly staff and super quick service. I ordered the Mac and cheese with beef. It is the best Mac and cheese I have ever had. It was amazing. Also great prices for downtown.
author: Brian M.

description: Kids each had spaghetti dishes and my husband had a grilled cheese.  I had a traditional breakfast.  Food was ok. Bill for four of us, with tip, was over $80.  I would not go back if i were in the area again.
author: Dana B.

description: Poor service. Greasy food. Expensive too. I understand it's SF but is a diner and a simple breakfast need not cost $15
author: Scott A.

description:
Sitting up abruptly, I rubbed my eyes and glanced around the dark San Francisco hotel room. It took me only a moment to recall where I was, note my wife still sleeping soundly beside me, and discover the two questions burning in my mind:

Why, oh why, am I spontaneously awake at 4 AM?
...and... 
How quickly, at this unholy hour, can I locate, acquire, and consume a bagel and egg sandwich?

I never got an answer to the former, but a stat Yelp consult pointed me at the Pinecrest Diner, within one block of my hotel.

I was seated immediately. Pinecrest is your basic American greasy-spoon diner, which is good, because that's precisely what I was looking for. The object of my ravenous craving was promptly delivered, along with a suitably oleaginous (look it up) side of hash browns. 

The scrambled eggs were slightly overcooked--but try to find a diner that does otherwise. (Good luck with that.) What the eggs lacked in finesse, however, they made up for in sheer mass. Sitting there in my little booth in pre-dawn San Francisco, I swear I could feel the gravitational pull they exerted on my fork. This was, indeed, the breakfast of my prematurely interrupted dreams.

Pinecrest only takes cash, so don't get caught unprepared. They've got a generic cash machine in the corner, but I wouldn't touch that thing with YOUR ATM card, if you know what I mean.

But if you've got a Jackson burning a hole in your pocket, and you're looking for a place where nobody knows your name--one that's open 24/7 for the sole purpose of satisfying your deep and immediate need for classic American diner fare--you could do worse than Pinecrest Diner.
author: Scott M.

description: This diner was quick and the food was delicious with large portions. Nothing else was open in the area . We went back 2 days in a row.
author: Nichole H.

description:
Came here with my family thinking it would be great. First of all we wait like 25-30 mins just to be seated & then after we are seated a little short guy asked us what we wanted to drink. Once he brought our drinks he basically threw the straws at us. That was a big NO! After that they some lady brings our food & the fries are BURNT!! All hard and gross. Not to mention a hair was in the food ! 
Once we got our check they ADDED THERE OWN TIP IN OUR CHECK ALSO!! THEY GAVE THEMSELVES 20 PERCENT  OF TIP! Which they did not deserve at all. After we asked the lady why the tip was added she said they add it on themselves ! Like without our permission!! Who does that!! They did NOT deserve a tip AT ALL!! THEY WERE HORRIBLE ! I WILL NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE !! DONT GO HERE !! NEVER AGAIN.
author: Ashley S.

description: I would've given it zero stars but it wasn't an option. I took my children for breakfast at about 10:30am. There was a party of three ahead of us. We were waiting inside and the other party was waiting outside. We were told there was a party ahead of us. We let them know we were aware. We were told we HAD  to wait outside. I was confused as to why we HAD to wait outside.  We had no intention of skipping the line of three. I informed the server that it was cold and my children and I preferred to wait inside.  We were told it wasn't an option and we HAD to go outside. I told him if this is how you treat potential customers we would go elsewhere. He said that was fine. So we took our business to Honey Honey Cafe & Crepery who served us with a smile.
author: Carrie S.

description: I went in during a peak rush on a monday night at 9:30. I was by myself despite usually eating there twice a week late night with my best friend. I asked for seating not at the bar and was told I couldn't take up a table. As a disabled veteran I need room to stretch my left leg out and the hostess gave me serious issues about seating not at the bar. After asking about the Americans with disabilities act and waiting for a regular seat a senior server made an issue about my sitting at a two person table. Heated words exchanged I was told that the ADA did not apply during busy times. I laughed at first then explained that I'd never eat here again... I walked across the street to Cafe Mason and now wonder why I ever ate that greasy spoon diner in the first place. Cafe Mason has my business because the foid and service is better!
author: Aaron Patrick R.

description: Good comfort food in the TL close to union square. Breakfast served 24 hrs a day! Highly recommend the bacon avocado burger and the Italian omelette (Italian bolognese with parmigiana and Italian sausage). They also have beer and wine (something you can't find at most diners).
author: Sarah N.

description:
Come here if you're looking for a diner in Union Square.

I will say, being from New Jersey, it is tough to find a diner that competes; however, Pinecrest was a very pleasant surprise! I really enjoyed the farmer's omelet. The waitress filled my coffee cup several times, which was much needed on a travel day. All of the staff was incredibly nice, helpful, and welcoming.
author: Michael N.

description:
I walked in at 1045a on a Thursday during the JPM conference. The place was half empty and I was alone. I was shown the only single seat left at the counter between two very large men. I certainly could not sit there without rubbing bodies with the men on either side of me, so I could certainly not eat comfortably. I wanted to sit at a table to eat and get some work done and so I then asked if I could sit at one of the many empty tables. I was told NO, so I left. 

Not nice, helpful, or smart. I was going to order eggs and french toast, scarf it down in 30 min and get back to work. Instead, I went to Jack in the Box across the street where they are a lot nicer and just as greasy.
author: Jessica H.

description: Waited too long.  The host was rude with broken English.  Food was over cooked and dried out.  Over priced.  Just bad.  Will never go back.
author: Earnest S.

description: I had two very enjoyable breakfasts, both very close to my Union Square hotel, during my recent stay in San Francisco. The Pinecrest Diner was the cheaper of the two, but still kind of expensive by other than San Francisco standards. The diner is open 24 hours, and does a thriving business around peak meal times.  Personally, I like sitting at the counter in a diner, as I get to marvel at the frenetic activity of the short order cooks as they put out plate after plate.  The skinny (not me after eating here): good food, namely a copious Joe's Special and corned beef hash, decent coffee, and good service.  Come on in for a good meal at a reasonable price.
author: Tim S.

description: The service in this place is crazy bad. Don't waste your time, staff is rude and the food is trash. This place is a greedy spoon with the emphasis on grease. Cooks don't wash their hands and wait staff is gross. Cafe mason down the block has better food and much friendlier staff.
author: Daniel R.

description: Excellent food, service and coffee! Would highly recommend if near the Union Square District in San Francisco.
author: William M.

description:
The food was average. I got the veggie burger (forgot what it was called) which was pretty standard but the fries were pretty good. Not sure if I just ordered the wrong thing. We also ordered the combo platter which came with a good amount of yummy mozzie sticks, onion rings, and chicken tenders.

The waitress was flustered (I think she was the only one) but she was great. The atmosphere is cute, with that typical diner feel. Would go again but not if I had to wait for a table.

Visited 12/30/17.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Ducked in here to study for an hour before my server gig. 

Technically they require $7 minimum per person, but I asked the waitress nicely if I could just order a tea. She let me do it :) 

Standard yogi green tea teabag. Gave me a big slice of lemon as well, which really enhanced the basic tea.

For whatever reason, I kept smelling piss from somewhere. Not sure if it was coming from somewhere in the restaurant or from outside. Oh the joys of being in SF.
author: Angela C.

description: It was ok the steak was really rough and it came with tomatoes and lettuce which was hella weird the fries save the meal I should of just got the breakfast
author: Joseph R.

description:
Really busy diner for 9am, packed but we got a booth right away. 
Only slow because of the amount of people everyone was trying to look after, so no fault of their own.
Food was quite good, diner style food and wholesome. Very filling. 
Prices were okay considering it's SF, glad we visited to check it out!
author: Bec G.

description: 10/10 would recommend this breakfast spot! Coffee was great and the plates were ginormous! Not a huge fan of sausage or bacon normally but this place has the best of both I've ever had! Seriously, idk what they do different but it's incredible.
author: Alex S.

description:
Wait was short, the guy that seated us took our drink order. Ordered tea with honey, the guy brought a bottle with the top partially broken off, after inspecting the top there was hair on the lid. 

Once our waitress arrived we requested another bottle of honey without hair. Apart from that, the experience was ok. Large portions of food.
author: Julia M.

description: Got into town late last night and we were craving some food. Went over the street to Pinecrest and picked up two juicy cheeseburgers. A lifesaver :-) awesome taste, awesome service. And for us from Sweden it is always cool to visit a real Diner! Will be coming back for breakfast!
author: Thomas E.

description: Good solid breakfast that saw us through the day. Great coffee. Points off for greasy floor and the fact that the ham and egg scramble repeated on me all day.
author: JoAnne P.

description: This restaurant was recommended to us by a good friend. The staff was very polite and helpful. The food came out very quick and it was really tasty. We will definitely be stopping by again when we're in SF!!!
author: Will M.

description:
Thank you pinecrest. 
Great diner with quick service, which took me by surprise. A few years back, I left because after 15 mins, no one even asked us about drinks. 

The burgers are pretty good. Solid diner food. 
Try the avocado burger... mmmm!

After a night of drinking, I was happy to sit in the pinecrest and get to eat.
author: Christopher R.

description:
Pinecrest is a great after hours staple in the TL. I arrived at about 150am and was ready to eat, and they were already popping. I stood there and let two different servers know that I was there alone and was waiting for the next available. The first available was a booth and they said it was for parties of two or more. Being in the industry, I understand, and stepped aside as they sat two young drunk women. I stood back and waited longer as more and more after hours drunk people piled in. And as each party of "pretty drunk girls" stumbled in, they got a place to sit. Even as they keep pointing at me and telling the servers that I was there before them. No matter. They sat everyone else before me. 

I am a bartender and a server. I would eat, tip, and get out of the way appropriately. And I was never given a chance. After twenty minutes of standing there, and twenty minutes of people pointing out to the staff that I had already been waiting, no one ever acknowledged me except to tell me that they only had tables for two or more. 

For that, Pinecrest...fuck you. Each group of stumbling drunk women that you sat before me makes you look like the desperate asshole staff that you are. I had money, and an appetite. And I deserved at least acknowledgment, and a place to sit. I hope and pray that you have so many dine and dashes that you can't pay your rent. 

Get better at acknowledging your guests. ALL of them, even the ones that aren't a gaggle of "hot chicks". You look stupid, and very desperate.
author: Bruno D.

description:
Was excited to see the line out the door waiting to get in. 

Came for breakfast, waited 25 mins in line. Was seated, waited 10 more mins for someone to give us menus. Waited 5 more mins for the drink order, waited 5 more mins for the food order. All of it came out cold (with hot plates).
author: Scrandy W.

description: Late night dinner food after getting a buzz on. So happy we found it. Typical dinner menu nothing special and no surprises which is really nice. Patty melt and a milkshake hit the spot. Prices are good. Service was ok not great but the place was packed so I'll be nice.
author: Doug J.

description: Had a decent Greek omelet with hash browns. The food was served quickly and everything was efficient. The Mac and cheese looks tempting, maybe I'll head back there some time!
author: Jamie L.

description:
This place is somewhere you should invite your self for a meal. The spot is always crowded with costumers and the reason is fast paced restaurant with high quality food and great reputation.
The food is so tasty and it is one of restaurants I went in USA.
author: Atosa T.

description: Omelette finds back my life. Try house omelette heavencrythere are many meat suggestions but my favorite is still house omelette which has only mushroom and tomato. 24 hours omelette. Vintage diner style
author: Bpe X.

description: Stopped by for a little late night coffee and pie. We wanted to try PineCrest due to its old school feel. We enjoyed the cherry pie a la mode and the coffee was great. Not sure if I'd stop by for much more than breakfast and that pie.
author: Junior E.

description: When I visit San Francisco, I always stay at the King George Hotel, across the street from the Pinecrest Diner.  Of course it is my place for a great breakfast, and great service. The waitresses are always friendly and always seem to have a happy attitude even when under great stress from a crowded diner.
author: Don Z.

description: Favorite after hours spot. Definitely top diner in the city. The Reuben is my go-to and a must try. Don't sleep on the mozza sticks.
author: Moe A.

description: I know it's just a diner but after living in Europe it was so refreshing to be able to mix my meals and have pancakes and a sandwich and a piece of pie. Okay, so I opted for the huevos rancheros (delish!) but all the food mentioned was what my table order. Very tasty but unfortunately crowded with stressed waiters.
author: Kelsey L.

description: Sitting at a place, with barely any people, waiting 20 minutes to be attended, asking for service and being told they Will be coming yet no one comes, that is what it is to go there
author: Natali M.

description:
Solid Greek diner in the Tenderloin/Theater district.  All the standard breakfast and dinner options.  
The bowl of Greek lemon chicken rice soup was above average.  The grilled cheese with fries was exactly as expected.
The chicken piccata entree was a large portion and served with seemingly instant mashed potatoes and boiled veggies that were not overcooked.  The piccata was good; not great, but what are you expecting?
Service was courteous.  Place was clean.  Atmosphere is a cross between Seinfeld's diner hangout and Hopper's Nighthawks.
Good place to go if you're running late for a show at the Curran or just need some comfort food.
author: Boyo I.

description: Due to the line of people out the door waiting for breakfast (on a Monday) I was expecting something absolutely incredible. The city slicker in me should have known not to be that optimistic for a place with a line full of tourists out the door. Once we finally got in, I ordered the french toast. I've had better, it was very dry. But the service was very friendly and efficient. I would come again if there was no wait. It's just your good basic diner; nothing that incredible going on.
author: Gina A.

description:
I've walked by this place a million times and not once did I think about dining here but this past Saturday, I let Gavin call the shots.  Usually my trip to San Francisco consist of doing things that I want to do or hit up a bunch of bakeries and eateries but it wasn't the case this time.  

Gavin wanted pancakes so we waited about 15 minutes.  This place was super packed and we were lucky we didn't have to wait longer than that.  I skimmed the menu and noticed they didn't have a kid's menu so I ordered catering to him w/o the extra cost.  I would have ordered 2 entrees but saving money and calories seem to be my focus lately so I got the Pinecrest Special which comes w/ 2 pancakes (I added chocolate chips), 2 bacon, 2 sausages, and 2 eggs.  

We didn't have to wait long for our food to be out.  I ate fast because I saw the line at the door grow.  I couldn't exactly rush Gavin to eat but he ate as fast as he could based on my nudging.  He ate about 35% and I ate the rest.  The pancakes were fluffy, the eggs were overly cooked though but the bacon and sausages were fine.  

I left a good amount for the tip because of their hustle.  

I saw their hash browns and have decided I need that next time.
author: Tram N.

description: Great breakfast. The eggs Benedict was perfect and the potatoes were crunchy just the way they should be. Very short wait even first thing in the morning.
author: Rebecca M.

description: Can't go wrong with this one if you want old school diner experience. We came for breakfast and were seated right away. Quick service and good food. Perfectly cooked hashbrowns. Good omelette and country fried steak. Price is reasonable. This was our first visit and left very satisfied. Try this place!
author: Ana B.

description: Ate here after getting into town on Good Friday for a trip with my daughter. We checked out a few places but landed here for a late dinner. Glad we did. Great food, service and reasonably priced. We both enjoyed the food and local atmosphere. The menu has something for anyone to enjoy. I like hole in the wall local places and this was no exception.
author: James E.

description:
So we really enjoyed our dinner here, but... we didn't enjoy what happened after...

We ordered the regular cheese and jalapeno nachos, which were delicious. Plentiful great-tasting cheese and jalapenos, and the tortilla chips were thick and perfect, just like festival nachos. I mostly made my meal on those, and barely touched my hot link and eggs meal, however the hot links were really good tasting in that too. The over easy eggs were also cooked perfect with the runny yolk I like.

But, the nachos were most likely our downfall later.

About a half hour to an hour after, we both had the worst bathroom problems we've had in a long time. And this was NYE, mind you, so it really put a damper to the beginning of our night. We guess it was the nachos as that's the only plate we shared. Could it be old cheese? I don't know. It tasted great, but there's definitely something wrong with that dish. About 3 hours later we recovered and had a great rest of the night. But man, that sucked.

It's unfortunate because we really liked the food there, and they're open 24 hours. And bonus, they're near Ruby Skye! Oh well, I guess we'll have to find something else in the area for late night grub.
author: Melanie P.

description: Late night eats if your in the area and don't want fast food you can enjoy some breakfast here. The service was great and food was good. Probably frequent here during our stay after bar hoping instead of having jack in the box or pizza.
author: Efi E.

description: We passed by this place many times and I'm glad we popped in one morning for breakfast. Pinecrest is a decent, solid diner with good service and great location. I enjoyed my pancakes, very well made. I like their decor, nice atmosphere, the place feels homey but isn't small, it's roomy and fun. Comfy booths. The menu has a bit of everything you might want for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Is this spectacular? No, but they do a good job at decent, simple, fun diner food.
author: Jo S.

description: Eggs with feta available and they know how to cook it properly. That may sound like no big deal ("how difficult can it be to add cheese to eggs?" right?) but the maestros of their flat top know how to get the job done. One of the last of a vanishing breed of cafe diners, certainly in San Francisco. I hope they remain for years to come.
author: Arthur S.

description:
This place is stunning 
Queues out the door and Full at 9am so early bird....  
Tbe staff are brilliant and you can watch the food being prepared.. 
Excellent find not 5mins from Hilton San Francisco
author: Derek M.

description:
After our friend's fashion show at Ruby Skye, we headed over here for some late night grub to catch up.  We were deciding on nearby restaurants, didn't want Lori's Diner or Jack in the Box ya feel me?  I was sad for a brief moment when I realized Max's Cafe was no longer at the corner (fond memories).  We moved onto Pinecrest Diner. 

We were greeted immediately, and our server was super friendly.  I ordered the chicken pesto sandwich, my friend had the steak, and the other friend ordered fish & chips.  The fries are scrumptious, and my sandwich was on point.  I tasted my friend's steak, and it was juicy.  The atmosphere is warm and cozy.  They serve wines, beers, and mimosas.

This diner reminds me of Zim's for those who remember, and this is as close as it gets.  Those good 'ole days of SF are gone.  Glad to know I can still find a decent sit-down meal in SF after 11pm besides the usual Mel's Drive-In.
author: Christine R.

description: Really great American breakfast and traditional diner. Love this place for its authenticity and food. That line outside every morning, is there for a reason:)
author: Igor K.

description:
The food is good and our waitress pleasant. But I give them two stars because the person managing the door literally telling us in the middle of a business meeting that we had to leave because people were waiting for tables.

This rude behavior started 45 minutes after we arrived. We waited for a table too.

We had already spent $40 plus tip on breakfast. We politely asked this person to leave us alone to finish our coffee and wrap up our meeting. He kept harrassing us to leave.

I started shouting at this a**hole across the room telling him that I had never experienced such horrible hospitality and would never return.

If you want decent diner food (open 24 hours a day) and you don't mind being rushed and treated like a wallet instead of a person, by all mean patronize this place.

I will never set foot in this horrid place again. I am also a tour guide, so will make sure I tell my clients to avoid this place unless they want to just eat and run.
author: Norm G.

description:
Place gets slammed -- appropriate for a Tenderloin meets Union Square locale. Good coffee. Better than average pancakes. Outstanding omelettes. The Spanish one has avocado and they make the salsa. Spicy goodness. 

No substitutes so extras are a la Carte. Boo. 

But staff stay upbeat despite moving at light speed. 

I eat here once a mo the when España calls.
author: Tim P.

description: Came here on our first morning in San Fran. Having just come from the east coast, our body clocks were still three hours ahead, so we came here very early, not lines, no wait. This place is right on the corner of Geary & Mason St. It's a narrow diner, with booths lined up against the window. Typical diner styel menu, with a myriad of breakfast option, including huevos rancheros! Service was excellent and fast paced. My son ordered chocolate chip pancakes, my daughter got the french toast, my wife got an egg sandwich, and I got the huevos rancheros. The coffee, while not the best I ever had, was always being refilled. The food, when it came out, and rather quickly, I might add, was excellent. My son loved his pancakes, the french toast was tasty, my wife wasn't complaining, and the huevos rancheros were very good for being made north of the border. All in all, this place was fantastic. Highly recommend it. Quick tip: Come early. We walked past this place a bit later in the morning one day and there was a line of at least 15 people waiting out in the cold to get into this place.
author: Herb D.

description: Very solid diner experience...good, quick service and food was hearty.  Chorizo and eggs was very good (get the tortillas not the toast) and the bacon omelet lived up to its name.
author: Adam J.

description: What a wonderful part of San Francisco's wonderful past this little gem represents...and the food is hearty and the staff hustle. My wife and I had a great breakfast here on a busy Saturday and talked to the owner Bill and his son Pete for 30 minutes. They are part of fabric of this great city. I have visited SF for the past 50 years, coming from Vancouver, Canada. Pinecrest is what SF used to be. This is not a fancy place for sure but a place for authentic comfort food. The generous portions are matched with a staff that get the food to you fast and hot. And as we walked by it tonight at 9 pm, there was a line up that shows how popular this place is. Come and enjoy the food and stay for the hospitality. Thanks Bill and Pete for making this one of our most enjoyable visits to SF!
author: Glenn W.

description: I went in just before 2 am and found a seat at the counter. Made eye contact with multiple employees to let them know i was ready to order but didn't want to be too pushy since it was busy. 15 minutes go by and finally someone comes over, but this time it was too late for me to get a beer and i ordered my food to go. It took 30 mins to get "Cincinnati chili" which was awful. Total waste of time and money.
author: Christopher A.

description: This place rocks!  Great diner food and for a show, sit at the bar and watch the choreography between the cooks and wait staff.  They have it down to an art!
author: Larry M.

description: Horrible service, I could not stay! I walked in this morning for breakfast by myself and sat on of the many empty tables they had. The waitress came and instead of taking my order, she demanded that I sat on the bar because the tables were not for only one person. If I do not feel welcomed, there are many other diners that do. I went to Lori's which is much better and they do want my business. What a stupid rule!
author: Andres P.

description: We went here based on the reviews left here & it was super close from our hotel. They make homemade clam chowder on Fridays and it was SO GOOD!! Give this place a try!!! The staff were super friendly as well.
author: Karri P.

description: Food was ok typical dinner food but a total homeless hangout. While eating I was asked for money twice, asked if the could borrow my phone to make a call because there phone was dead. Also hanging out at empty booths guys clear them out so your customers can eat! Total distraction and won't be back because of it
author: Brian B.

description:
Popular in the mornings, most likely because it's surrounded by swanky hotels. Good sized boothes. Got my water but never my coffee, but they were slammed and there's free coffee at the hotel. They never charged me for the coffee either, so it's all good.

Standard American breakfast food and some with Spanish twists, like a chorizo omelet, for example. Less intimidating than my hotel's swanky restaurant where all the guests were in suits. This place was half the cost and plus you get to see your order being made if you sit at the counter. So... Entertainment!

I got there exactly at 7 and beat the rush by minutes. By 7:30 there was a line out the door, but customers were checking out, so I guess it goes in waves.
author: Matthew T.

description: Great late night snack...sat at bar and ordered wings, mozzarella sticks, and beer. Wait was kind of long but still good service!
author: Lana S.

description: Really poor customer service. When I was greeted at the door the staff asked me to sit at the counter because I am a party of one. Turns out there was no clean setting at the counter and the heat eminating from the stove was too much. Given there were 5 available booths, I moved over to one. About 10 minutes later was told by two different staff that I couldn't sit there. Explained the situation in depth to both of them. They blamed it on a change in shift and tried to force me back to the counter. Asked for a manager, apparently there was no manager currently working.
author: Christine A.

description: I came to SF on business and my flight was delayed, so I didn't arrive until late - and I was HUNGRY. Thank goodness Pinecrest was around the corner from my hotel. It was packed in there, but we were able to grab a seat pretty quickly. I had the portobello mushroom sandwich and it was out of this world. Service was a bit slow, but as I said it was packed - so I let it slide. Whenever I'm in town, I'll definitely swing by.
author: AR K.

description: I've walked past this diner for years but had never actually gone in. Today we were early for a show at the Curran Theatre on the same block and had time to wait in line for a late breakfast. The staff was efficient and hospitable and our waitress was really sweet. I had a bacon omelette, my wife had a Belgian waffle and our daughter had mac and cheese. The food was outstanding and the portions were generous. We love the Pinecrest!
author: George W.

description: No A/C, extremely hot and uncomfortable place. Very unpleasant staff - we were allowed to enter with a stoller but then another servant asked us to remove it as it was on his way, our baby was sleeping inside, so we just left this place (and nobody even brought a menu for us).
author: Sergey R.

description: Nothing over the top to write home about. Just good food and good service. However, I saw some food safety violations as one cook was making cold sandwiches with his bare hands. That's just gross. Otherwise everything seemed good.
author: Tim A.

description: Stopped here for breakfast. The wait time was short even though there was a line.. Service was quick. The greek omelettes were fab and overall everyone was happy with their meals.
author: Diarmuid M.

description: Incredibly unfriendly and rude staff. We didn't even get seated before we were insulted by the waiter. We'll be taking our business elsewhere.
author: Shaun B.

description: I love pancakes and have eaten them all over the US. These are hands down some of the best pancakes I've ever eaten. A ton of buttery flavor. I would stop in every day just to eat the pancakes. They rival the Dairy Bar in Madison, WI.
author: Howard G.

description:
I had not been to pinecrest in years....10-15 years. It used to be pretty good.

It is not the same owners..so that explains a lot of it.

Burger was of the costco variety ( I can make that at home). 

Fries were limp and soggy ( insert double entendre here)

So for a meh burger and a coke was 17 dollars....I would go to Louie's bar instead!
author: David G.

description: Ate at this restaurant and the food wasn't bad. However, upon leaving the wait staff was extremely rude. I had asked to see the receipt for the meal we ate and as he walked away he said I was cheap.. by asking for the receipt. He also threw someone else's receipt at us and said "just take it." Extremely rude and uncalled for experience.
author: Lauren A.

description: My oh my!  Huge portions of tasty corned beef hash, eggs, toast and hash browns.  Open 24 hours with a very prompt and pleasant staff.
author: Gary K.

description: Good value for money if you consider the amount of food you are getting  with respect to price. Nothing special about the taste. I ordered an avacado burger and there was no avacado, it was like 4 am so when I asked for the avacado they brought it immediately. It was a below avarage bun without any spread or sauce, lettuce, a slice of tomato and patty. Patty was fine and they also serve bunch of fries on the side. Smooth service, polite staff, just lack of taste.
author: Fikret D.

description: I can't speak to the food because they would not seat me at a table.  The host wanted to seat me (solo) at the crowded bar even though several small tables were open. I asked nicely if I could have a table and he just shook his head no.  I've never had this happen at a restaurant before.  Also, there were already two tables with solo diners seated, so obviously they didn't have a hard rule about seating solo diners at the bar.  I may try again another day and update my rating if I have a better experience.  Sure looked like a good breakfast spot.
author: Clint K.

description: Breakfast here was fantastic! We had the country steak and eggs as well as the pinecrest special. The gravy on top of the steak was to die for! The service was quick too
author: Laura D.

description: My boyfriend and I were in San Francisco for 5 days and we went here for a meal 4 out of the 5 days.  The food is amazing.  We had breakfast, lunches, and dinners here and were never disappointed.  The onion rings are the best I've ever had.  It helped that this place was right across the street from our hotel, so it was very convenient.  Compared to the Mason Cafe across the street, Pinecrest is by far superior!  Prices are cheaper, and the food and service is wayy better here!
author: Allison C.

description: Would never eat here now.Do you all know what happened here in 1997? The cook killed murdered the waitress Helene here in 1997 if you Google murder at the pinecrest and the year it will all come up the cook died in prison later in year 2000.I ate here once only in the early 80s but after this happened it would make me sick to actually come in here and sit down have a good time with a friend at the table and pretend this never happened .its s disrespect if you ask me.if I was the owner I would of closed down the place for good.it was all over an order if eggs the cook and waitress fought over ! Seriously I hope you guys read the articles on this.you need to know.she was shot several times in this diner blood everywhere on the tables floor food etc.I find it sickining that the owners kept this place open after all this ! I could never step foot in this place after that !!
author: Denise C.

description:
Dinner/late night - love a good diner, but seriously, Lori's across the street is so much better. When I go to a diner late at night, it's usually because I've been drinking and I'm craving french fries.  I really want to love Pinecrest Diner.  The set up kind of reminds me of a Waffle House, so maybe that's why it feels nostalgic.  

Every time I've ended up here, I leave with food on my plate.  Not because I'm completely full, but because the food is always disappointing.
author: Chloe M.

description: Don't eat the burgers. I should have known walking in not to expect much. I ordered the burger combo without cheese. This was not worth the $12 I spent. Oh why, oh why did I expect a fresh burger? The patty is your generic frozen patty you can get at Safeway. No flavor, no seasoning. I slapped so much mustard and mayo on my burger to get some kind of flavor, but ditched it halfway through cause I couldn't stomach it anymore. The pickles included also made me sad. I love pickles. But these were just sad and flavorless also. I'm only leaving 2 stars because I asked for crispy fries and got crispy fries and those were good. Probably won't be back to this place.
author: Princess D.

description: Old fashioned diner in the heart of the city.  Basic burger and fries and a salad all prepared fresh with fast and very friendly service.   Love this place!
author: Dennis R.

description: This diner had a wonderful shrimp Louis salad, great French fries, speedy service, friendly employees and was right around the corner from our hotel!  Who could ask for more??
author: Lisa S.

description: We have been loyal fans of Lori's Diner for over ten years. Then we came to the Pinecrest Diner. Fantastic large breakfasts with amazing food quality. Be prepared to get here early for a seat. 7:30 am or earlier. Line will be down the block at 9:00 am.
author: Reb B.

description: We sat at the counter and we could watch the cooks, they were amazingly fast. Food was good and plentiful. I had the Pinecrest special omelette and very much enjoyed it.
author: Rich B.

description:
Well, actually we wanted to go to Dottie's True Blue Cafe since they have a 4,5 stars average rating but guess what: they're closed on Tuesday and Wednesday (that's awkward!) Anyhow, we ended up at the Pinecrest Diner. This is like what you expect from that typical American diner that you see in the movies all the time with "garçon, coffee please" situations, huh huh!
So we sit down and make our orders with that nice Hispanic servant. We get an order of mozzarella sticks to start with some nice tomato dip. Yummy, not great but good. 
I get a stack of pancakes with some strawberries and maple syrup for 12 bucks. The mozzarella sticks (10 pieces I think) came at 8 bucks. For 4 dishes and drink plus 1 starter we pay 115 $ with tip. Again not cheap but the food was good and the service nice. Plus we got the experience of eating at a real American diner! Nice! Go there and check it out!
author: Hannes M.

description:
Great little place in the heart of SF! We stayed at the Union Square Hilton downtown so this was a short block walk from the hotel. There's always a line outside (the place is 24 hrs) but it moves pretty quickly. Think we only waited about 5-10 min. 

The food is amazing! Perfect portion sizes! We shared The Spanish Omelette w/ English muffin and a short stack of pancakes. 

Great tasting food, great service! No wonder this place has been here since 1969! Will definitely return on our next visit!
author: William B.

description:
We had about a 15-minute wait before getting seats at the counter. 

Our omelettes were really delicious, the hash browns crispy and soft, the coffee (well, it's diner coffee) and the staff helpful and friendly. It appears touristy but it's classic diner
author: Christopher M.

description: The 24 Hour breakfast is amazing. The food is delicious, quick and the service is good as well! It's a smaller diner so expect a wait.
author: Alyssa G.

description: Solid diner food in the heart of San Francisco.
author: Dennis L.

description: Good place for a cheap meal. Nothing special. Waiters were pretty slow but friendly. I ordered the pinecrest breakfast special. The sausage and eggs were good the pancakes were very average and a little rubbery. Go here for late night if you want breakfast drunchies, other than that, there are better places in the area. I won't be going back anytime soon, but again, not terrible. You really get what you pay for.
author: Katie G.

description: Do yourselves a favor: sit at the counter seats in front of the grill. The three kitchen staff and the dishwasher are CHAMPIONS. I was mesmerized watching them work and basically killed my night.
author: Mona N.

description:
I think we've all seen the painting of Elvis, Marilyn Monroe, and Bogart huddled together late at night in a corner diner.  Pinecrest may have been the inspiration for that painting.

Despite having a burger three hours earlier but burned it off by walking at least five miles through the Streets of San Francisco (Chinatown, Financial district, Pier, and then back to Union Square area, I found myself famished at 9:30 PM.  A decent Yelp review and a huge menu lured me in.

I was with a favorite colleague and we found a great two seat window table so we could watch the interesting night life go by.  We weren't disappointed, either by the scenery or the food.

I ordered the hot Italian omelet smothered in chili.  A bit of a risk since I had to do a 5K run the next morning as part of the conference I was attending but had no ill effects. The omelet was huge and excellent.  It came your choice of bread and hash brown.  The 'browns were of the typical diner variety but cooked perfectly.

Elvis et,al might not have been in the building but the cook made up for it.  Thanks for a great meal and show. 

3.25 Stars, worth trying.
author: Scott C.

description:
The service is terrible.
I saw the waitress serving the table next to me and her finger was in the oatmeal (I think it was oatmeal).
That did it for me.
I left immediately
author: Stocky G.

description: Excellent diner with prompt service. Great steak and eggs!  You know you're at a good diner when it's always busy. Not overly chaotic but buzzing at a good speed.  The food is always fresh and prepared well.
author: Matt E.

description: food was ok, but the atmosphere is great. I really liked sitting there, specially by the window. the food is ok though. location is good too in the middle of downtown.
author: Iman B.

description: Ordered the Spanish omelette as it looks good in the picture online and it has a bit of everything in it. Add sourdough toast to go along. Typical American breakfast; can't finish unless u didn't eat for a day. Omelette was pretty decent with the cheese n salsa sauce. Goes well with toast. Gd place to return since it's 24hrs diner.
author: Jeremy K.

description: Not very friendly staff, rude. The service was slow and it took forever for the food to come. They should hire more waiters.
author: Jenny C.
