description: Oh. My. Gosh!  Now this is a real diner.  We arrived at the peak of busy on Saturday night.  I had a super fabulous Cobb salad and my dining companion had the fried chicken.  I was so satisfied with my salad.  It truly was perfect.  The fried chicken was the CRISPIEST I have ever tasted.  I was a tad dismayed by one of the waiters.  I asked him about the wine selections and he said, "we have red and we have white", but couldn't tell me what varietal it was and had an attitude that I asked. *shrug*  There is something for everyone  here in your party and you will not be disappointed.
author: Kelly M.

description: Great breakfast and fast friendly service. Wish we lived around the corner instead of across the country!
author: Beth R.

description: After a hungry disappointing encounter at Daily Grill restaurant  down the road...  Just had a great overall experience at Pinecrest Diner SF! We thoroughly enjoyed the food and the service was excellent! Our Waitress Cristina and the busboy were very friendly! Definitely a win! And we highly recommend this SanFrancisco Institution! We loved our Cobb Salad, Grilled Chicken breast! Fresh vegetables and house made dressing is exceptional! We'll be coming back!
author: Anna Marie E.

description: Probably the best breakfast I've had here in SF. Great staff all look happy and if you want to get an idea of how efficient they are sit at the bar.
author: Seamus R.

description:
Darn fine coffee here. 
This is a nice little consistent oasis in a really rough food neighborhood. Over the years I have seen so many places come and go with good reason. The Pinecrest sticks in there for consistency and good plain quality food. The service is always quick and efficient and they have Stella on tap. 
Don't waste your time with Lefy O'Douls or others in the neighborhood. This is good breakfast all day long.
author: David B.

description: We waited in line for 30 min - went on New Years weekend - inside is super clean and the food is pretty good - awesome bacon - BUT TERRIBLE SERVICE! Didn't have knives when we sat down and we asked for them and they didn't bring them until half way through our meal. Also we were with 4 and the orders came out not all at the same time. I'd go here again if I didn't have to wait in line but it definitely is NOT WORTH WAITING IN LINE FOR!
author: Michaela W.

description:
This 24 hour diner has great food for the price and location. The service is on par with what you'd expect from a diner. The restaurant is old and smells like it but the furniture has been updated and is comfortable. I was impressed by their somewhat healthy choices although was disappointed that my oatmeal first choice wasn't available. 

Pros:
Open 24 hours
Great location from union square
Great avocado egg white omelette 

Cons:
The odor of the restaurant smells of old building
author: Michael T.

description: Great place!! Orders are filled to specifications... If you go during rush hour expect a wait, the staff works their butts off and does their best to take care of all of the customers equally and efficiently!!
author: Nicole P.

description: The breakfast here is HUGE and delicious! We were walking around 8:30 AM and saw a line outside the restaurant so figured it must be good. I ordered the chicken fried steak breakfast and it was delicious and big enough to have leftovers for at least another meal or two. Service was kind, but rushed as the placed was PACKED. Would definitely come back!
author: Sheridan B.

description:
We came in around 6:30am on a Saturday and could easily get a table. By the time we were finished with our (very tasty!) breakfast, the place was getting busy. 

No-frills diner with lots of breakfast options - we had the pancakes and the breakfast sandwich and both were very good! Also loved the hashbrowns. 

Minus 1 star for service - wasn't terrible, but we never received water and had to go to the front to get our check because it was never brought to us.
author: Holly S.

description: Excellent experience. Fantastic mozzarella sticks mac and cheese spaghetti salad soup. Just saying that it was a good dinner Place. Excellent Diner. Go.
author: Matthew G.

description: If you want a disgusting, dirty meal, this is the place to eat.  The food was terrible and afterwards we were rushed out immediately before we were completely done.  Go anywhere else!!!!  And the bathrooms are disgusting and you would be better going to the bathroom at a prison.
author: Joy W.

description: Very busy very good.  I wasn't told I'd be changed 4$ extra for chicken sausage I just paid feeling lucky to get seat at counter. Would return again. French toast delicious.
author: JoAnn W.

description: Would give them no stars if I could. Ordered, they screwed it go and wouldn't fix it yet still charged me. Horrible customer service. I don't mind when mistakes are made but I do expect to get what I pay for. Staff should I'd be fired.
author: T G.

description: We just had some great bacon cheeseburgers. I got garlic fries and he had the regular. As you can see, it was delicious! We asked for medium rare and got exactly what we asked for. We paid $25.95 total, including tax! This is great for San Francisco. Our waitress was friendly, and I saw her talking to some tourists helping them decide where to go next. We will definitely be back!
author: Jill R.

description: I will remember this place where they deducted their tip from my change, without consulting with me. Very rude! Did not feel welcome as a tourist. The Pinecrest special should be their "flagship" dish but was a disappointment.
author: Richard D.

description: Delicious food, loved the atmosphere. Will trade my granny for a lifetime supply of hashbrowns
author: Emma A.

description: I wanted some breakfast and I saw it was a line outside so I was thinking it must be good. I was greeted with a warm smile from the owner and son I believe. This business has been here for almost 40 years, prices are very reasonable for the area, much cheaper than a lot of places. I am very happy with food and service I will be back to this restaurant for breakfast
author: Ashea M.

description: Ok food. Ok prices. Just bummed because one of the workers was pouring coffee for my friend over my plate and spilt a bunch of coffee in my omelet. Had to eat a coffee soaked omelet for $13. Didn't seem to care or anything. There's a million diners in San Francisco..find another
author: Grant F.

description:
A combination of things gone bad. 

First, the waiter insisted on knowing which drinks we wanted even after we said we were not drinking. Then, we ordered a waffle that was pictured with strawberries. I asked to add banana and ice cream. The order was ready but sitting and waiting for the server to bring it to our table. The food was equally disappointing.

The strawberries were so dry that I can only imagine they were pre-cut in the morning (we were there around 9:30pm) and the ice cream that was supposed to be strawberry flavor, tasted like some cough syrup.

Lastly, the extra charges for my alterations made the desert cost double the price.

So, just don't go there, it's not even clean...
author: Nusa M.

description:
Best poached eggs I've ever had. 
Often, when I order my eggs poached at other restaurants, they're not done quite properly. But these, time and again, are flawlessly poached. I come here once or twice a week for soft poached eggs with perfectly crispy bacon and the most heavenly hash browns. 

I like to hash up my breakfast and poached eggs make for the perfect egg without random fat. Save the fat for where it matters: bacon. 

It is said you can tell the quality of a cook by how many kinds of eggs they can cook: don't let them fool you - they can poach like any Michelin star I've been too. They sometimes don't like to poach during busy periods but if it's slow and you're a regular it's no problem. 

Sometimes I've overhead tourists being told they don't poach- not true, just come back a few times and ask again. It's a one of a kind, quirky place that keeps that old San Francisco feeling.
author: First L.

description:
This is one of the best places to eat in this area.
Located on mason street close by several hotels and union square the pinehurst is open 24 hours and sometimes  late at night it's fun to watch what comes in the door. 
The breakfast rush can get super busy-sometimes there's a line, but there is most always room at the counter. If you are at the counter you get to see your food getting cooked.
Iv'e always had superior service and both the cooks and waiter cope flawlessly with my partners penchant for special orders.
The lunch and sinner tems are pretty good, but the breakfast is fantastic.
Portions are large so bring your appetite.
If I'm staying in SF I'm having breakfast here.
author: Steven W.

description: This place was Excellent!! Food was DELICIOUS staff was very friendly.  Very pleased  Overall. Portion size was excellent, Very prompt service,  Food was all cooked fresh I had a New York Strip my husband had California Macaroni OMG totally recommend these two plates. happy customer totally coming back to eat here again.
author: Sly P.

description: This was definitely a good place to venture. It was within walking distance of our hotel and we did not know what to expect. They were very accommodating to large crowds and very busy. But despite their busy wait staff they were still friendly. I ordered the Portobello Mushroom sandwich which came with fries which I substituted with sweet potato fries. Generous portions. Definitely a good selection. I did go the healthy route in order to try out their dessert. I opted to get the banana split and it is definitely worth a try. The presentation and condiments involved in the banana split was pretty involved and I commend the staff for how fast their service is. Overall great food and fast service.
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
Busy little place.  Do they pump in wood smell?  It truly smells like wood.  Albeit, very nice and warm service.  Thumbs way up.

Joe's Special ($12.50) -- beautiful plate. Large portion, very fresh, delicious.  Fresh spinach, mushrooms, and ground beef were used.  Crisp hash browns.  (4.5 stars)

It's a diner, aged but a relatively clean one, worthy of your shiny nickel.
author: Randy B.

description: Good size menu and it is open 24 hours with a good location just of Union Square. Food can be hit and miss but the portion is always a good size and the price is reasonable. Staff could be friendlier.
author: Tanya B.

description: I love eating breakfast at Pinecrest Diner. My friend and I have been here twice, and are never disappointed. We were going to eat breakfast at a new place today, but decided to go back to the diner. We waited in line for about 10 minutes. We got seated at the bar, which was totally fine. It's always a good experience from the servers to the cooks to the people. I love the food portions and a hefty portion of avocado when asked for it. This will definitely be my breakfast place when I'm in the city.
author: Brenda L.

description: Redeemed!!! Went back for that amazing salad and boom the service improved so they just gained two stars.
author: Laurie L.

description: Weekday around 10:30AM. I came in for breakfast, there were only a few other customers there. I ordered breakfast and had coffee. I'm not in a rush just drinking coffee and reading the paper. About 20 minutes later my food showed up and everything was cold. Obviously they forgot about my plate.  They asked if I want a new order or did I want to leave. I said a new plate which arrived in about 5 minutes and was hot. Unfortunately the bacon was way over cooked.
author: R R.

description:
Super solid breakfast. It's a little pricey, but I think that is to be expected for that area. The portions are very generous, and it's classic greasy spoon goodness. Very prompt service, and everything was really tasty. It tends to get busy, and it's pretty small, so you may have to wait. 
I went for a late lunch (around 3pm), but still got breakfast, because that is how I roll. It was the perfect time to visit. Not very busy, plenty of counter space. I dig the classic vibe.
author: Caddy M.

description: It was an okay spot. A lot of traffic, prostitution, and drug dealers....... we were uncomfortable and decided to pack our food togo.
author: LaDi AsiAnDoLL T.

description: Do not come here tourists before 2am. Yes, 2am... Why because as a SF resident you only come here after the club to have drunken food.
author: Sarah T.

description: Very pricey, very salty, very shady service. My utensils were not clean. The server threw my plates on the table. Had an extremely bad attitude and then was really cocky but it caught up to her when it was raining and the floor was wet and she slipped and busted her head. Sometimes it's best to remain humble and provide good service cuz this will provide you a better tip. I feel bad for her and gave her a 15% tip a salad and nachos that were extremely salty and unedible cost me a whopping $50. I was extremely unsatisfied all around thinking that this would be a cool dive dinerbar with the local restaurants nearby that I'm a little bit more familiar with. Good luck here and I hope you enjoy it I thoroughly did not. But everyone's experiences will be different on any given day. I was there in a bad day and I was there with bad service and I will stay with bad food. I would not use the restrooms here if I were you. Everything inside the building past the doors smell like urine. Again it might have been just me but this is on a Sunday evening when it was not busy to receive this type of service or food and apparently no care for the conditions of the place to eat if I had known this before hand I would have not engaged in any kind of food had a soda and went across the street.
author: Phil H.

description: Overpriced.  Food was good but was made to sit at the counter which was uncomfortable.  Coffee sucked.
author: Carmen D.

description: I wish this place was good because it's open 24 hours, but it's awful. Subpar food and rude service. It takes a lot for me to write a review, let alone a bad one. But after giving it a second try it's just not good. Suggest avoiding especially since there is an excellent breakfast place right across the street.
author: Tom G.

description:
I have been coming to Pinecrest for a long time, but last night, it was not so impressed. I like to come here on Friday for clam chowder soup which is my bf and I love. It was so busy as always, and we were waited to order for 20 mins. We waited anyway. Drink came out fast as usual. I ordered hot chocolate. When i first tasted it, I could taste that it was not the same hot chocolate I had here. kinda salty and weird sweetness, so i asked them if they change sugar or chocolate. he said they change chocolate and it comes in a small bag. I dont know what brand of hot chocolate it is, but if the owner is reading this. The old chocolate is totally better. not sure if they want to reduce the cost or anything, but i never taste hot chocolate like this!! really dislike it

Also, the clam chowder soup was not good as we had before. we both agree that it was too creamy and salty. This was my first time complaint about the soup. I was so obsessed with it, but if they want to keep it this way. we might have to find somewhere else.
author: Paradee S.

description: We make sure to go here every time we are in San Francisco-usually after we have been drinking and need some delicious greasy food. It's always great food and people watching is always good entertainment at Pinecrest! A must for breakfast.
author: Leah P.

description: Had the Worst Experience.. Myself and two other Security Officers dropped in for dinner tonight before we started our security detail. Sign read.."Wait to be seated " The Hostess was too involved with her conversation with another employee to GET UP and greet Us. Simply "Barked out Sit at any open booth! 8mins later..the Rude helper asked if we wanted water..We couldn't get straws or even attempt to order! 3 African American Professionals were treated like crap! We got up and left..Only to be insulted by the staff!  I will NEVER spend a dime in this establishment!
author: Ross T.

description: It's delicious and feeding me up. My first meal in America. The waitress is very kind and smily.
author: Sylvain W.

description: Really good breakfast for cheap! We were staying at the king George hotel across the street and decided to stop in for breakfast before some sightseeing. Good food, they moved the line quickly, and prices were very reasonable for San Francisco. I'd go again!
author: Kristi H.

description: This place serves amazing quality food for amazing prices! Best diner hands down! Great customer service from start to finish. Food is made ready to order and fresh not frozen!
author: Alexis M.

description: Been there three times already for breakfast  since discovering this place. Food is excellent and service is quick. Sometimes the line is quite long outside but well worth it! My go to place when visiting San Francisco.
author: Trevor M.

description:
This diner is fabulous! Generous servings of good old fashioned meal styles. We came for dinner last night and then back for breakfast today. It's a good diner vibe. Open late as well. 
All our meals here were great and I would highly recommend it. Well priced also.
author: Allaine M.

description: Absolutely the best french toast I've ever had! So good, I returned the next day to have it again!
author: Kristian S.

description: This used to be my favorite place to have coffee for almost 20 years. The window table is amazing you see life pass by. Today the place was half empty and I pointed at my usual table and the waitress and the busboy said I have to sit in the counter since I was by myself. Damn I felt insulted. I've put in thousands of bucks in this joint and they showed me shit. The food is not that great either. I want someone else to buy this place pronto
author: Nicolas A.

description: Awful. I never leave bad reviews. Total and complete garbage. See photos for my meal and a side of "cheese".
author: Bobby H.

description: The tables at the end of the room smelled really bad. Like dirty water stuck around it. The server that gave us the table had a horrible attitude and wouldn't let me explain that we wanted to change table. He didn't even let me talk. He is a short guy that won't give me his name. The other lady was nice. Poor customer service, the venue not nice.
author: Armando P.

description:
Food is ok. Soggy waffle. Ok hash browns.
Coffee is excellent.

They RUSH you to leave but then when you ask them for anything they ignore you. How can you leave when they won't bring you a bag and container for your leftovers?

Bathroom - gross. Just gross. Down 3 flights of greasy stairs. Dirty. Smelly. They lost 2 stars just for this alone.
author: Steve W.

description:
Don't go to this place!! Try anywhere nearby. We walked in and the waitress ignored us for 5 minutes, just walking past us and pushing us aside. Then the bus boy came over and did the same, getting dirty dishes from the front of the restaurant.

The food looked alright, but everyone in the restaurant looked miserable.

If you're ever in LA and want a REAL diner experience, go to Scotty's Cafe in Whittier. Their first location burnt down, but you can still feel the love in their food and atmosphere.
author: Melissa Y.

description: Best Mac and Cheese I've ever had. Service was what one would expect from a diner. It was a very satisfying meal.
author: Sharah M.

description: This place had a weird smell when we walked in and we never really got used to it. other than that, short wait for the food, not too crowded at 9pm. I got a delicious and hefty amount of Pastrami on my Pastrami on Rye. The bf got a great cheese burger and chili fries. Delicious diner. We would come back!
author: Elana And Tamar B.

description:
My favourite diner in SF! And not just because it's near the hotel I stay at while I'm in town. Pinecrest beats out some other nearby diners like Cafe Mason and Lori's because it gives a good diner experience without the grease. 

I've eaten some sandwiches, appy's and fried chicken (surprisingly delicious!), but my go-to meal is breakfast. I love the Pinecrest omelette which gives you a bit of everything thrown in, comes with side hashbrowns and your choice of toast. I love that the hashbrowns are the ones I like best -- shredded, not cubed -- and are always nice and crispy. I'm also a fan of their pancakes (beware: they're huge!). To round it all out, the service is friendly and very efficient. 

Pro-tip: go at night when it's less busy and you can still eat breakfast!
author: Colene C.

description: Good food and efficient service. The Restaurant is small and not enough seating. I ate here 3 times while visiting the city. Would definitely recommend
author: Sandra M.

description: Cooks working hard, but food is not high-quality, meals not cooked well, extremely overpriced for the results you get
author: Brent C.

description:
I had a feeling before coming here that we would be unhappy with our choice, but given that it was Christmas day and that everything was closed, we had very limited options when it came time for brunch.

The line up was big, and it took some time to be seated. Once we were, we were placed right next to the door which was constantly being opened. It was therefore very cold and very uncomfortable to be seated there, and so we asked to be moved if possible. Our server basically told us that we could leave because he wouldn't seat us elsewhere, however, the manager caught him and quickly had us relocated as soon as a table freed up which we appreciated.

However, not only was the food sub-par at best, but the service was very very slow, and our server was pretty rude (same guy as above) which made our experience at Pinecrest bad. We had ordered the mac and cheese, 2 types of omelettes, and the pork chop dishes all of which were either lacking in flavor or of bad quality.

Despite being in a great (touristic) location, I would not return unfortunately. San Francisco is full of excellent food so don't worry about finding an awesome alternative in the area!
author: Noha G.

description: The onion rings were great but the pancakes and the waffle were tough. I will try this place again, however.
author: John G.

description:
Bad Service..... expensive food,  we will never go back and will tell you ...........
DON'T Waste your time trying it
author: Michelle F.

description: The food is terrible and the service sucked. Only reason for 2 stars is because the waitress running the place is with child
author: Brianna F.

description: Great find, big breakfast at a reasonable price. Staff was supper friendly and attentive. Coffee refills never stopped.
author: Donato P.

description:
Found this central downtown diner.

It did not disappoint at all.

The service was fast and friendly and we got to sit in the window.

The drip coffee was great (and I mean really great) and the portion sizes were overly generous.

This hit the spot and did not disappoint - it's very central so the price reflects this.

We had pancakes and strawberries with a side of sourdough and two eggs and link sausages ( with amazing hash browns!!!!)

It's a good, friendly and safe bet - which left our belly a full for a fully days San Francisco exploring - I'd defiantly go back !
author: Ash T.

description: Nice place to dine for some down home no frills breakfast. Stood in line so got to survey the food before actually going in. Everything looked good. I had the pine crest special which hit the spot. I would recommend this place to everyone
author: Marlene T.

description: Tasty comfort food at a reasonable price. My wife had a albacore tuna sandwich which she said was fresh and tasty. It was more then she could eat though. I had a mushroom and cheese omelette smothered with homemade chili. It turned out to be a delicious combination. Went around 8 on a Saturday night and had only a 10 minute wait before being seated in a comfortable booth. Although it was busy, service was great. Glad we tried it.
author: Scott F.

description:
This is my favorite sport in union Square!! They serve breakfast food all day long!! Big portions! Everything is super delicious!! Ive been here quite a few times and I love it!! 

There's always a lil bit of wait although I've never waited more than 15 min. 

It's absolutely worth the wait!!! If your in SF you HAVE to come to Pinecrest Dinner!!!!
author: Maya R.

description: Solid four stars.  Great diner feel and perfect for some grease to cure a hangover.  Breakfast omelets are delicious as well as the tuna melt for lunch. Love sitting at the counter top and watching all the action. The wait line moves quickly so don't let that intimidate you. It's worth the wait. One of our favorite breakfast spots in San Fran. Two omelets and two coffees was $40 a bit pricey in my opinion but it's worth it. Meals are big enough to share if you want to prevent that overstuffed feeling. We will be back.
author: Corine M.

description: Unfortunately I will never be coming back. I ordered french toast and it was awful! It wasn't even done all the way. The egg was still very much so inside the toast. At least if you're going to not cook your food all the way can we have a warning!
author: Nia S.

description:
Hands down the best place for breakfast-based restaurant in downtown San Francisco! 
I had steak with eggs and I couldn't forget how flavorful my steak was. It melted in my mouth as I took a bite.
However, the long wait would be the biggest issue. But it's definitely worth waiting for.
author: Vi B.

description: Good diner food. Love the huevos rancheros. I bit pricey for a diner but the tables are big and the service is good. Bay shrimp sandwich is delish.
author: Stomparella J.

description: This place is hopping! Line out the door at 10am but still got immediate seat at the bar.  Omelettes and hash browns look consistently good and the cook is genius at flipping the pancakes. Giant iced tea is just what the hangover called for. I don't see the grease in this greasy spoon. All the food looks great and the team cranks out food like an efficient machine.
author: Karen C.

description: Staff was so friendly! The food was amazing and the portions were incredible! Line is out the door but it goes fast and it is sooooo worth it!! Also reasonly priced menu for anyone.
author: Shana M.

description: Quick service. Amazing food and it was worth the price for what we got. The staff were very friendly and fast on their feet with orders. Going back again for breakfast and it's open 24 hours so that's a plus!
author: Kosta S.

description:
I heard wonderful things about this restaurant and that it's one of the best diners in the area but apparently only if you have 2 hours to waste and you hate life. I really wanted water and everyone in the whole place and probably folks waiting outside got water before I did. I asked between 2 and 4 times for water. I knew the food was going take long that's koo I just wanted water. There's just one guy cooking it all for the whole place..props yo. 

We got our food into the wee hours of the morning and it was wrong but I didn't want to wait another hour for them to make it again. When we paid we told the waitress and she said yeah bruh I know sorry. I should have just went to the pizza place across the street and been on my way. They are always good and fast and tasty. Unfortunately I paid $30 to be trapped there. I wouldn't really recommend it.
author: Kyle G.

description:
My wife and I had breakfast here on a Saturday morning and the entire experience was very good to excellent. This is a relatively small restaurant, so expect to wait a bit. But, it is worth it.

Service was prompt, pleasant, and accurate. Both of our breakfast meals were excellent. We stayed at a hotel near Union Square, and this was by far the best breakfast we had during our stay.
author: Howard S.

description:
On a very hungover-ish morning, my coworkers and I decided to go get breakfast. This joint caught our eye because it was a.) A diner and b.) because it advertised as being open 24 hours a day. 

When you walk in, it's definitely a diner. Booth seating and bar top seating. The place is pretty small but we managed to find a lot of seats at the bar top. Our view were the cooks and the servers. Speaking of, the servers were a bit much. They were all over the place and really flustered. I do appreciate the positive attitudes though. They were super nice. It was just a little much with people running around. Aside from that, here's what I had: 

-Pinecrest Omelette for $10.95. Bacon, Ham, Sausage, Mushroom, Tomato & Cheese. This was a HUGE omelette, definitely worth the price. Lots of meat and cheese. I loved tomatoes and mushrooms as well, so this was on point. This dish was served with crispy hash browns. Great combination!

-Side of Pork Sausages for $4.75. The side was served with 4 sausages and happened to be the same sausages in the omelette. It was good, nothing stellar, but definitely appreciate it at a diner. 

All in all, I LOVE that this place is open at night and throughout the wee hours of the morning. I'm totally coming back to have their food again. If you're staying around that area or just looking for a down home diner, come check them out! So good!
author: Rockne H.

description: Laid back casual diner. Nothing fancy, no pretentious menu items, just a good selection of everyday diner and comfort type foods.  Service was good, place was clean and noise wasnt bad.  Had Super Nachos and cheese sticks (Only meal today).  Both were very good and satisfied my hunger and tastebuds.  Prices are quiet reasonable for this area and portions are decent sized.  If you just want simple, this is it.
author: Chris H.

description: Didn't even make it in the door! Very very very rude!  Pulled people out of line in front of others and yelled at customers in line. I would give no stars if possible. I don't even want to try the food. Go around the corner to La Marsa it's amazing!!!
author: Michelle M.

description:
Had dinner here. Fast friendly, greasy. 

I did see the line for breakfast several mornings. It was quite long each time.
author: Al C.

description: Really tasty food and probably worth the queue. Once we had sat down it took some time to get our order taken - 3 groups, who arrived later than us, got seen to first! That said, once the food came it was delicious- cracking burger.
author: David W.

description: I am use to coming here by myself because I figure they have good food this time they are so rude and I told them I wanted a booth they tried to force me to sit at a counter that I don't want to sit at and refuse to serve me even though I have been here several times..dont bother with this place
author: Arelle O.

description: Awesome place to eat. Great for any meal. Very busy but it is well worth the wait. The portions are big and very tasty! The staff are friendly and helpful even though they are constantly busy. Great place to eat any time of the day!
author: Aidan B.

description: 5 "Diner" stars easy. One of the best signs of a good diner is seeing the potatoes cooking on the grill right as you sit down. Greeted with smile hot coffee and quick order. Breakfast was served in less than 10 minutes. Greek omelette with sourdough toast and hash-browns coffee ($16) Waiting line a front door... so I sat at corner. This place does a great job turning tables. Always full so during the weekends prepare to wait for a booth. No larger than parties of 4.... one table will accommodate 4+. Counter is first come first serve.  Breakfast portions perfect good prices. If you're looking for your $5 espresso drinks and stuffed French toast with home made blah blah blah... don't come here.
author: Don Y.

description:
I tend to consider myself somewhat of a breakfast connoisseur, especially when it comes to the spud! Cooking hash browns, home fries, hash, and the like are not easy to do. This crew was on point! The omelet was full, the hash browns were crisped to perfection, and the bacon... oooooh the bacon. Too many places skimp out on good bacon to save a few pennies while still charging a premium because of the word "bacon". This place is not the case. Not only was it thick and perfect, they laid the bacon on top of the hash browns occasionally. This did two things. First, prevented the bacon from over cooking and drying out. Second, the bacon grease helped season the hash browns. The whole process was a science. These guys were maestros of the spatulas. Oh by the way... there was a full house, a line out the door, and I got served in about 5 minutes after ordering. I was stunned. Hats off to them all.

EDIT: Furthermore, I want to add that I will go on record to say that this is literally the best breakfast for the price that I have ever had. It tops my previous all time favorite: Stella's Diner in Syracuse, NY.
author: Edwin R.

description: The breakfast menu is typical for an american diner. Eggs, hash browns, bacon. The staff is friendly and food is served promptly.
author: Nikolai S.

description: Great food, lots of options & fast service! Little crowded but the workers were on point even though it was crazy busy at 12 am! Good prices for a place being downtown too. We were pleased!
author: Jordyn P.

description: Quick snack stop, exellent food and service, the place needs updating though would come back
author: Miguel R.

description: The atmosphere was very nice & the employees are friendly & attentive. The french toast I ordered was delicious & my husband liked the country fried steak he got as well. Would definitely return!
author: Sanithia C.

description: Classic diner fare for breakfast. Really long line in the morning though - lots of hotels / hostels around
author: Darren N.

description:
on a street full of crack dealers, this is a pretty classy joint. It's warm and cozy and the waitress is friendly. a real darling of a restaurant, especially compared to the other 24 hour option, jack in the box, across the street. 

Call me crazy, call me cheap, but this food sucks and is over priced. I ordered the pinecrest special and a coffee. 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, 2 jimmy dean sausages and 2 anemic little slices of sad bacon ran me 20 silver backs. is that just what the world has come too?
author: Max C.

description: Mmmmmmm. Breakfast was great. There's gonna be a line, but this is SF touristville (which includes me). Food was good, delivered quickly, and hit the spot. I'd recommend it.
author: Don F.

description: A convenient diner located a few blocks from Union Square. Me and my friend were strolling one morning and we saw this place. There's a really long line so we assume it's very popular. We decided to try this out first thing in the morning the next day. We came in around 7am before the influx of people. It's a no frills, old-fashioned diner. Nothing fancy. The food is very delicious and servings are big. If you love breakfast this is a good place to go to. Downside is like mentioned, it's very touristy and popular so expect long lines and waiting times.
author: Mikhail F.

description:
Horrible Dining experience. Ordered a beer at about 130 am and got it 20 minutes later. Only had it for 10 minutes and with no warning of 2 am the apparent "manager" came by and took it away. Didnt really make a big deal about it and then went about eating my burger. Then he insists on coming back and point his finger in my face, saying that if he had been doing this for 14 yrs and if i knew business or something then i'd know how to be a business man lol.Totally did not know what he was trying to argue about. Then out of no where he threatens to call the police with his sassy princess attitude. I only got annoyed at the fact that i was trying to enjoy my food and he just wanted to argue and got all defensive over a beer. The other gentleman waived the charge off and was working to diffuse the situation. Even after I paid the "Manager" came back to argue and run his mouth again. Pretty sad.

My buddy order a plate of fries around the same 130 time and received super late after I finished my burger. Not sure what happened there.
author: Roneil S.

description: Had late dinner with my family and saw this 24hr diner on yelp. Decided to check it out . Had the chicken pesto sandwich , my niece had combo platter and my cousin had cornbeef and eggs . Food was ok. It was a busy evening but servers were nice and personable ... Would visit this place again if am back in town ...
author: Jane A.

description:
Breakfast was great. Simple, no nonsense bacon and over easy eggs with hash browns and sourdough toast. Bacon was not skimpy, good portion of a plate and eggs made just right. 

My only peev was watching the cook (who was amazing at running between the grill, the stove, and sandwich area) open the fridge, grab raw hamburger meat, place it on the grill, then proceed to the other fridge to grab lettuce! Then he put together the other raw ingredients of the burger, but never washed his hands in between! I just get worried for the customers w sensitive stomachs... He did do a quick swipe at the cloth dangling from the apron. :/ 

But really, otherwise, service is good. People are friendly.
author: Tea Lyves ..

description: The rudest experience I have EVER had at a restaurant. Before we paid they asked us to leave because we had been sitting too long (45 mins). they also asked another gentleman near us to leave, told him he had been there too long and people were waiting. He was still eating and they were trying to clear his plate away. Rude staff!!!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Great breakfast. PERFECTLY prepared! Super fast and friendly service. 
Their coffee is simple. Simply excellent!
Prices are reasonable for the area.
Yum!!
author: Charles S.

description: Nice traditional American diner! I ordered a steak and it was surprisingly delicious. I asked for toast and jam after dinner which I treated it for my dessert and it was on the house. I love this place. A must visit if in the area.
author: Suria N.

description: Great food and big servings at a reasonable price for SF.  Very comfortable booths and nice ambiance for a diner.  Service is good and they turn tables pretty quickly so we've never had to wait.  The Bleu Cheese burger was good and the onion rings were tasty.  I think they make their own ranch dressing so that was a bonus.
author: Ann-Marie J.

description: Arrived a bit after noon on a Monday. It's seat yourself and there was no wait, but it was busy. Service was prompt and food was great! I'd definitely come back.
author: Jess P.

description: We ate here on a Friday night after hearing it would be a 2 hour wait at Cheesecake Factory. My husband and I were pleasantly surprised ! We ordered a salad with Italian dressing; the dressing is  really good. I ordered a Reuben And the Bacon mac and cheese and my husband ordered another pasta dish topped with chicken. Everything was delicious. The bacon mac and cheese was a total hit. It was so good that we came back a week later and I got the mac again. No wait on a Friday night. Tasty diner food.
author: Mara R.

description: Great place with the small town diner appeal. Hot food made to order and you can watch. Friendly staff and they keep the bums outside instead of letting them roam in a ruin a meal. Congrats on that as that is a chore alone. You can eat well, get full and pay without waiting and your drink never finds a bottom. Love this place and when here in the city it's my only go to for breakfast and a lot of suppers. Great place if you like the feel of the diner.
author: James L.

description: We stop by this diner every time we visit San Francisco. Great breakfast and lunch plates, with generous portions. I like the chicken fried steak for breakfast, some of the best around - just be prepared and be hungry. For lunch, try the patty melt with onion rings - this one's my favorite. The place doesn't have great ambiance but it's a diner, and that's what they do best, they sling out awesome plates of food 24/7. See you there.
author: Phil T.

description:
I ate here begrudgingly as unfortunately I was the only one in the group willing to wait 2 hours for a table at Brenda's. Regardless, I tried to embrace the diner concept and accept the fact that the place smelled identical to McDonald's. 

On a brighter note, the menu did at least offer me a chance to fit in a healthy meal. I went for a bowl of greek yogurt with fruit and was pleasantly surprised that the yogurt was the real unsweetened stuff. And the portion of both the yogurt and fruit was almost too much. Respect.

The rest of my dining mates ordered more traditional breakfast options and seemed pleased enough. While I wouldn't classify Pinecrest as a destination diner when in a city so rich with breakfast food options, it is open 24/7 and will do the trick when you're not like me and don't want to wait in a huge a** line for higher quality food.
author: Meghan H.

description:
Very yummy fresh breakfast. Some old guy and his wife cut through the line lol I guess if your old it's ok ??? I'll remember that when I'm old haha 
Overall it's a quick in and out eat but simply Perfect :))))))
author: Parisa S.

description: Great meal and friendly service. Enjoyed the portobello sandwich. But you can get breakfast 24 hours a day.
author: John M.

description: Great diner food. The service is slow and you might have to wait for a table, but it's well worth it. My husband asked for a substitution on a meal and the server recommended a different meal that had everything he wanted instead of charging us extra. I liked the variety on the menu; it really has something for everyone, including my 2 teenagers. And the fact that they're open 24 hours makes it that much better.
author: Leiloni B.

description: union square, but bordering tenderloin...corner 24-hour diner...weekday lunch hours and busy, but tables or counter seating available with no wait...open kitchen with cooks working...standard american diner menu..service is bit slow, so expect an hour lunch...taking a reuben $12.95 and diet pepsi $2.50...reuben was quite generous with the thick-cut pastrami slices...cheese melting over meat...light on the thousand island dressing....toasted griddled brown and tasty....standard fries to the side....a good sandwich meal for $20 after tax and tip...
author: Hen A.

description:
Excellent breakfast! The scrabbled eggs were amazing! A friend had pancakes, which I tried, and they were top notch!! 

Service was good, coffee was good and we left feeling very satisfied :)
author: Steve B.

description:
Came here around 10pm with a friend and wanted really to just get out of the cold. We saw this was open and decided to give it a shot.
I ordered the corned beef hash with eggs and hash browns. I really liked the corned beef! It wasn't too salty like some other places make it. Everything was cooked great. My friend got the spicy chicken sandwhich and said it was REALLY spicy. He had to drink a lot of water during it.

Overall, staff was very polite and helpful. The manager..  Owner..? Working there took his time to pour hot sauce I wanted into a cup and helped many other people while I was there.

Will go there again in the future.
author: Melissa S.

description:
Jetlagged out of my mind, I had breakfast at Pinecrest Diner recently on a Monday morning around 5AM. Interior wise, it is a pretty standard diner. I sat at the counter and started with coffee. I had a hankering for biscuits and gravy -- not on the menu and the server said no dice, so instead I opted for chicken fried steak and eggs with gravy.

The highlight of the meal was the hash browns -- tasty and well prepared. They do not offer poached eggs? Had over easy instead -- good, but eggs are (or should be, at least) pretty much automatic at breakfast places. The gravy was average at best.

All in all, it was a pretty middle of the road breakfast diner experience. It filled an acute need for me in the wee hours of the morning, but did not make a lasting impression.
author: Billy B.

description: Food is fine. Service is fine. The $3.50 for a cup of coffee and $4.25 for a cup of apple juice is absurd. Family of 5 (3 small children) for an average breakfast at a diner should not be $80.
author: Andy S.

description: Food was good, but the people working here are amazing. Hard workers, friendly, and just doing their job right. I'll be back on my next visit. F1
author: T S.

description: If you're looking for the classic diner food, this is the place to go. Everything was cooked perfectly.
author: Evert P.

description: Part of our Christmas Tradition is to see "A Christmas Carol" at the A.C.T. Theater and then off to BEST diner in town. Any burger is gonna be great but for me it's all about the Mediterranean Plate.  YUM!!
author: Annastasia A.

description:
We took a break from eating at our hotel for breakfast this morning, and decided to try this diner one block away and we were pleasantly surprised. It was half the price of our hotel breakfast and the food was just as good! I had the chopped ham and eggs scramble with hash browns and crispy english muffins and my hubby had the ham steak breakfast. Both were delish and cooked exactly how we ordered it. It's difficult to find restaurants who don't serve you doughy under-toasted english muffins, but I asked for extra-toasted-extra-crispy muffins and they served them spot on! It put a smile on my face to not have to send them back! The hash browns are also cooked to perfection (so many restaurants undercook those as well), so all in all, there wasn't a bite left on either of our plates. 

It's a small place, but the staff does a great job at clearing tables and getting everybody seated. We scored a booth and enjoyed our meal. They've got lots of menu options for breakfast, so we'll definitely be back to check those items out.
author: Roma B.

description: This is one of our go-to places when we're in the City. I was here during my Great Divorce Weekend of 2006 after a hard night at Ruby Skye. I have been here while on family vacays. It's just one of our stops when here. Food is good and greasy and totally hits the spot after a hard day of shopping. The place is a bit crowded and hard to walk around in but overall the food makes up for it.
author: Monica H.

description: Not a very good first impression. I happened across this diner while walking to another diner close by so I stopped in. I was seated at the bar and waited patiently. I was offered a drink after about 5 min. 15 min goes by and I've not been able to place an order. Steak and eggs is a favorite anywhere I go.....  however, I watched the waiter take the order of two pretty young ladies who sat two seats down from me right away, and he still continued to pass me by. Another ten minutes and I just left. Not waiting more than thirty minutes before my order was even taken....Loris diner will work just fine for me. Thanks guys. But no thanks.
author: Carter S.

description: Perfect diner After a night of drinks!! Omelettes are top notch!!!! Service was a little slow.. but there was also a rush of people that walked in when we had. Worth the wait.
author: Ashley E.

description: Had breakfast here and it was served fast, they were friendly and breakfast was good. Not too pricey. Had Denver omelet and just two eggs over easy With hash browns and toast. We couldn't finish it.
author: Patti B.

description:
Sometimes, a place can be invisible, even though it's been there for generations. Even though you've walked by it for years. You just walk on by, someplace to go, someplace more familiar...

And then, suddenly, you're hungry and it appears, kind of like a beacon of authenticity among the chains and tourist places that are trying way too hard.

So you go in.

It's crowded.

It smells good.

The only place to sit is at the counter.

So you sit. 

And suddenly it's 1955. Nothing's changed. It's warm. The windows are steamy. The outside world fades away.You've entered an epicurean time-warp.

The guy at the next seat is wearing a tweed jacket and saddle shoes and is that woman in the booth really wearing a little hat a gloves? Yes, she is.

My friend orders eggs, bacon, hash browns, the whole shebang. I just order corned beef hash (crisp), because I wanna see 'em sling it.

We sit there, gabbin'. Watching the chef ply the grill with plenty o potatoes and boatloads of bacon. 

No-nonsense waitress lays down plates. Big plates. Full of food. Perfect, like from a your grandmother's Betty Crocker cookbook. The hash is crisp, just as ordered, yet still tender inside. Eggs, sunny side up, bacon crisp, toast wheat buttered. 

Everything's cooked right, everything tastes good. The prices aren't 1955 but they're not 2015 Union Square, either.

You eat and are reminded why you eat. To be whisked away from your day, thrust into the moment, and float into the past of what yo momma used to make.

Then you pay at the register, and you're back on the street, and it's 50 years later, and you think about when you'll be in the neighborhood again, so you can once again go back in time.
author: Daniel W.

description: We had a great breakfast here at the bar. The diner is very cozy and inviting. Probably the best hashbrowns I've ever had. I had the Greek omelette with feta cheese. It had the right combination of eggs spinach tomato and cheese.
author: Petet H.

description: During a recent visit to SF, I made a point to stop by the Pinecrest Diner.  I usually visit this diner every time I am in SF and had a great experience as usual.  The Pinecrest is the standard "greasy spoon" with typical "diner" food.  I usually stick to their omelettes for breakfast and burgers later in the day. As usual, this visit did not disappoint!  They can be rather busy during peak hours, but they are open all night long!  If you need some food before bed, this is a great spot to wind down and have some good food!
author: Peter M.

description:
We are not locals but visit San Francisco often!!! This is a must stop for us!!! The food is delicious and simple! 
*Tips* 
- you may have to wait in line outside as this place is always busy. 
-best for small groups of 4 or less people. 
- breakfast and lunch foods here are the best.
author: Christine F.

description:
My husband and I both enjoy coming to eat here, just a few blocks away and breakfast all day! It's an old diner with a big menu, and it's usually always packed with a very small space by the entrance to wait for a table, but the staff is really good about clearing a table for the next guest, so we have never had to wait more than 10 minutes.

It's also a good place to sober up, and the food comes out delicious every time! Of course, it's not gourmet and the food presentation seems a bit outdated, but I love getting their chicken fried steak and eggs. We've only tried a few other dishes but so far everything has been to our satisfaction. 

However if you get a booth by the window (which is a 50% chance of happening every time) I've experienced some creepy guys always knocking on the window and just.. staring. And they've always just done it at our table for some reason, whether they're drunk or just.. creepy. Both times the diner has been too busy for us to say anything to the wait staff, but I'm not sure if I even should bother since they're usually gone if you ignore them. *sigh* is this the TL people warn me about? Whatever it is, It's not going to stop me from eating here! :)
author: Jenny M.

description: One night after a late turn up we decided to go eat & this was the only place opened 24/7 ...... it had the best food of life & the best eggs and the best part was that you could see the guys cooking & it was sooo good! would recommend this place! & im not from SF i'm from LV & this is the best food i've had in SF!
author: Athziri S.

description: We came here after the suggestion that this place was good. I am almost certain I am closer to developing a lung cancer after the sheer amount of second hand smoke I was exposed to. On top of that the service sucked. We waited so long for our food, and the server never checked in with us.
author: Sister N.

description: I'd like to review the food here but we left before we ate for two reasons. First, the rude, rude, rude man barking at the customers to WAIT OUTSIDE!  Ok, we get it. Maybe put up a sign saying something like, "Kindly wait outside, we'll call you in."  And upon arrival, there were people waiting inside. So I guess the rules change by the minute. Second, they charge  $7.00 to split an entree. Same amount of food mind you, just an extra money grab or to force you to order food you don't want. Umm, hello?  Obesity problem in America much?  I'll NEVER step foot in there again. We went across the street to Cafe Maison and they didn't blink an eye when we told them we wanted to share.
author: Marilyn L.

description:
So unbelievably disappointed. I was prepared all night to give the Pinecrest Diner at 401 Geary st a 5 star rating - the food was great (I love greasy diners), the staff EXTREMELY friendly and hospitable, the service punctual, informative and professional. So what's the one star for? Well, I'm a first-time visitor here in San Francisco. I just got off a 2 thousand mile Greyhound journey delayed by Texas blizzards and tornadoes (and I therefore probably do look a bit pasty). I had already spent a night at a hotel and I didn't want to spend more money on another night - so I thought I would kill two birds, checking out a 24 hr diner in town, while also working on a little writing and reading until my City bus tour at 11am. (And yes, I had a red gym bag with my belongings inside it - but I explicitly asked the host, before I sat down, whether this was welcome - and he told me it was OK!)

But because I'm not some bum who squats in businesses, I ordered about 30$ worth of food and drink throughout the night and tipped something like 22% (but maybe that's a low tip here in SF? Where I'm from that's considered mildly generous - I would have tipped more had I realized). And I was at pains to tell my waiter (who, from overhearing their conversation, I later found out is a rookie) and his co-workers several times throughout the night that, since I was alone, if they ever needed that table for a bigger party (there is limited space here - a fact about which I was conscious and considerate) they need only say so, and I would move back to the counter; that I was willing to order more food (and I said this in response to whispered comments I had overheard between the waiter and his superior about my not having already ordered more food - BUT THAT WAS ONLY BECAUSE I WAS ASSURED BY THE PRECEDING SHIFT THAT THIS WAS UNNECESSARY - AND THEN I WAS ASSURED *ONCE AGAIN* BY MY WAITER, AFTER I OFFERED TO ORDER MORE FOOD AND SHOWED HIM MY MASTERCARD, THAT IT WAS UNNECESSARY TO ORDER MORE FOOD **AND THAT I WAS WELCOME TO STAY**) or even leave, if there was a problem with my hanging out like that. And I deliberately chose what is probably their worst table so I would not be a nuisance. (And I saw a homeless man practically bathing himself at a better-placed table by the window around 3am -  he wasn't given so much as an awkward glance, let alone the treatment I eventually received.) 

Everything was FINE until the shift-change came (and if it is their policy that overnight guests must leave before the shift-change then WHY THE FUCK was I not told beforehand?) and some balding, pink-shirted *ASSHOLE* - avoid this man at all costs if you do not want your Pinecrest experience spoiled; I was not the only person he was needlessly rude to (but I repeat: he was the exception not the rule) - abruptly walks up to me (I had already been planning to leave soon after ordering a coffee and breakfast to go) and says, you need to leave now because you're not ordering food. Then I say, but I did order food - and I was about to say that I'm perfectly willing to order more food, or even offer another tip to the waiters for being so great throughout the night - but before I could speak he cut me off and said, well that was 5 hours ago (NOT true - I had ordered a 15$ meal right before breakfast around 5 or 6am) and I want you out of here right now. He said this loudly, and rudely, in front of the ENTIRE diner. NEVER so embarrassed in my life. I was COMPLETELY stunned. It was NOT my fault, if overnight guests are not appreciated, that I was misinformed by some pasty-haired rookie and ignoramus.  I'm so angry right now I cannot keep my hands from shaking. I am now, and have been for about an hour, sitting across the street at Jack in the Box where no one has even looked at me funny for not ordering anything yet (though I will be ordering coffee and a Danish before I leave - BECAUSE I'M NOT A BUM) wishing I had come to this cheesy franchise instead of trying out what had been a very cool diner. 

If someone from this business happens to come across this review and would like to offer an apology or at least a f****** explanation for this extraordinary treatment  today then I will duly reconsider this review and my rating - but unless and until that happens I will NEVER AGAIN come within a mile of this dump and I will warn off anyone who will listen.

(And yes, I understand they have to be wary of homeless people. But considering how I payed, and the fact that I had a  highly priced smartphone - which they AGREED to charge for me - and a few relatively expensive articles of clothing - NOT trying to boast - I cannot fathom how I could possibly have been mistaken for a down-and-out. But anyway, WHY WASN'T I ASKED? I could very easily have shown that I am a tourist with spending money - which was one of the reasons I needed my phone charged. So that I could reload my MasterCard. AFTER I had already payed off the original bill. Assholes.)
author: Jon J.

description: Long established diner near Union Sq and one of few places open early for bkfast on a Sunday morning.  Food was better than expected, but service was terrible.  Ordered OJ and had to remind server twice.  Coffee refills require tackling any server with a coffee pot since asking your server for a refill doesn't work.
author: John F.

description:
Stayed down the street and saw a line several days so we decided to try it 

Ordered an ice tea and Diet Coke got a water had to remind them several times for the Diet Coke but rather apologetic about the error 

Pastrami on toasted rye plentiful and lean only yellow mustard but hey this ain't the east coast   The pastrami was not as spicy as I'm used to but still very good   Fries were the coated type not my fav but ok. Dill pickle rather bland I'm used to the garlicky ones back east 

Spaghetti and meat sauce very good it had mushrooms and green peppers mixed in again not as spicy as back home but still very good 

Side salad was a decent size with fresh ingredients not out of a bag 

Not fancy 
Not expensive 
I'd go back
author: Alex P.

description:
This place was awful. I usually reserve 1 stars for awful service or food poisoning but the food here was so bad that it actually warrants 1 star. We ended up here at around 2:30am. The place was surprisingly busy but we were seated pretty fast. The waiters were busy and a bit snappy.

However like I said the biggest issue is with the food. I wasn't too hungry so I just wanted some eggs. I look for eggs on the sides menu and wow they cost a whopping $6.10! I literally thought it was a joke! Maybe it cause of the entire murder thing but honestly they're really trying to cash that old story in... I ended up ordering the hashbrowns and my friend gets the chicken tenders and fries. 

The chicken tenders taste like microwaved ones from the store and the fries were bland and somewhere between stale and limp. My hashbrowns were even worse. There was almost no crunchy portion and the WHOLE THING WAS YELLOW. From the look (and taste) the cook put half a stick of butter on the grill then threw on the potatoes. It was absolutely inedible.

It's nice that they're open 24 hours but unless I need a coffee, I think I'll pass.
author: Vivian C.

description: Pinecrest diner mite be one of the best places for classics in all of downtown San Francisco. Classic diner style food, comforting home style ambiance, and amazing service from the staff. I stick with the eggs and bacon, the club sandwich, and the cheeseburger! Christina and Nadia always provide me amazing service and fulfill my needs before I know I have them. This place makes my day every time, cheers!
author: Robert G.

description:
Good food, service not so much.
Tasty burgers especially the ones with avocado. Nothing extraordinary though. Waitress seemed a little stressed the whole time.
author: Maurice H.

description: This place is awesome!  We were staying in Union Square and came in because it was one of the only places open late.  The menu was insane!  It took us forever to decide.  There were tons of options and everything sounded so good.  I ended up with one of the best turkey burgers I have ever had, my daughter loved the chicken gyro) said it was the best one she has ever eaten!) and my girlfriend loved her turkey sandwich and fries.  Next time we're in town we will definitely eat here!
author: Melissa B.

description: Classic diner in downtown San Francisco near Union Square. Typical diner menu with reasonable prices in an otherwise expensive neighborhood. Really we enjoyed the turkey club. Make sure to opt for the San Francisco sourdough bread. Fries wee crispy and steaming hot. Sit at the counter for quick service.
author: Karen B.

description:
Surprisingly, this place has a lot going on for it! It's open 24 hours, has great friendly staff, great diner food, and large portions. What else could you ask for? It's become a go-to lunch spot for my coworkers and I.

I'm dropping a star because it's a on the overpriced side for what you get. A diner omelette and coffee with nothing extra shouldn't run you over $20 with tips like they would here... It's just 3 eggs and some potatoes, man! I guess you can get away with it when you're placed right in the heart of touristville by Union Square.

Overall a great place for breakfast/brunch though, and plenty of lunch and dinner options. Here are my top picks:

Spanish Omelette: So good but VERY heavy - you need an immediate nap after that early meal. Comes with really tasty hash browns. My pick for their must-try menu item. Be warned that if you're a calorie-counter, you're probably out for the day (same goes for most items on that menu though, to be honest)!

Italian Omelette: Real good too - also comes with hash browns. Meaty, yet surprisingly much lighter than the Spanish omelette.

Southwest Burger: Juicy, yummy, but fatty and sloppy. You immediately feel guilty after this oily bad boy. Comes with fries that are impressively good!
author: Nizar S.

description: We really liked this little place.  The cheeseburger was one of the best I've had in a long time. As a musician we are on the road weeks at a time and we try a lot of burgers, Pinecrest knows their stuff. Others in our party had breakfast and they all enjoyed theirs too. Larger portions and excellent food all around. There is a $7.00 minimum to eat here which I assume is intended to keep the large homeless population from camping out at a booth.  The service was slow and not a real friendly but heck for that burger I was ok with Vulcans running the place.
author: Steve H.

description: Great service, a little crowded hence it being in Union Square. The only reason reason for 3 stars is because it is very tiny. Besides that, no complaints.
author: Barry C.

description:
Our family of four had a great dining experience at this little diner before heading over to the ACT theatre to watch Satchmo. The place is a gem of an old time dive with wooden booths and counter seating. Get the Greek salad so good and fresh our teenagers dug into it while having their fantastic burgers and fries.  The kitchen staff and the waitress are lovely hard working people very friendly and caring.

The Pinecrest is an authentic diner that deserves more business.
author: Elaine L.

description:
First off, I've only eaten here very late at night - it's near my favorite hotel Clift - but I've never found the food of particular note.  At 2AM, I'm not picky.

However, this last visit was astoundingly awful.  There is no excuse for chicken tenders to be raw inside.  I will NEVER return.
author: Dylan S.

description: Love the Pinecrest special. Their bacon and sausage are super crispy, just the way I like it. Everything was cooked to perfection, and it's one of my favorite diner in SF. Wait in line wasn't so bad, probably around 15 minutes or so. But it's worth it!
author: Putri I.

description:
We came in with a group of 12 people. I had the Reuben and it was the best I have ever had. The other 3 at the table had the California Mac and cheese, some pamodoro dish (sp) and the carbonara. There was enough left for another meal. 

The prices are good and the service was great. They even charged our phone for a bump of power at the end of our day touring.
author: George A.

description:
I've been to Pinecrest a few times and normally enjoy myself. This time, not so much. The food is always amazing, the service has rarely been up to par.

This visit was full of lack of attention and scoffing when my table needed something. One of the servers non-stop complained to the manager who was sitting and eating right next to us. The cooks slapping each other on the butts, eating on the floor, then continuing to cook. 

We saw our server maybe three times and that was after we had to ask for one of the bussers help. She never once came to ask how anything was. Every time our server passed by us she blatantly ignored us and the fact that we needed more to drink and that our silverware was dirty, once again scoffing that she had to do something. 

It also seemed like the manager was holding employee 1:1s directly on the floor (at the bar specifically). One server complained for a straight 15 minutes about how she treated a guest, how another employees schedule impacted her, etc. It was annoying, distracting and could have been done in a more private area if the manager really needed to hold a 1:1 at that exact second. 

I felt bad for the table next to mine. They weren't greeted and kept looking around for someone to help them. Of course is was the same inefficient server. 

When we left there was still no acknowledgement at all that we were guests in their establishment. The entire experience was horrible, save for the food. The one star is because the food is great, but there needs to be a major overhaul with the staff.
author: Zachary N.

description: Good food, fast service. Went on Sunday at 0730 and sat right down, but when we left at 0830 the line was already out the door and down the street! Around 20 people in line to sit. So get up early and go eat!
author: Jake V.

description: Had veggie eggwhite omelette at the counter. Service was good and breakfast was yummy!
author: Catherine J.

description:
Typical all nighter diner. Serves greasy cheese filled food, cold beers, and smells like a hamster cage. Wait, wha?

We tried the overfried sampler platter and the weirdest version of chilli cheese fries I've seen since that episode of Man vs. Food where he had to...awww nevermind. The service was great and the price wasn't bad either, but it wasn't enough to earn a coveted third star. 

This place was recommended to my friends and I after a night of drinking and hunger pains started to set in. We arrived at the Pinecrest Diner and were immediately greeted with smiles and the mild smell of a pet store. If wasn't over powering, but enough to make you wonder about the source of meat in this place. 

We sat down and ordered a few beers and our food. This place actually had a decent beer selection, Anchor Steam, Stella, Peroni, and the usual American standards. 

The food came out and we sat there for a second to assess the situation. The sampler platter consisted of; chicken fingers, onion rings, and mozzarella sticks. All one color, dark brown. There was one point where I  couldn't tell the difference between the chicken and cheese sticks. This still tasted, OK. I mean it's fried cheese, typically a solid choice. 

The chili cheese fries on paper looked great, in person not so much. Hardly any cheese, tons of beans, and almost no meat. This also tasted like the room smelled. Yowza.   

My phone died before I could snap any pics of the food, but would avoid this place if you can. If you're in the Financial District and need that post beer food option I recommend going somewhere else because there's like 4 other diners within a 300 ft radius of this place.
author: Nate M.

description: Never again!!! The place may be the busiest but that's because it's on a corner. The food will taste fine, but the end result the next morning is never pretty. I have eaten here numerous times, and every third or fourth time it ends in catastrophe. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me...
author: Zachary T.

description: No frills family diner.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Wanted a late night dinner. The food was terrible. Burgers were well done although I asked for M and Taste bad. Onion rings were. OK at most. Their cheese is aweful...really.low quality. Seems like they don't really care tbh.
author: Jacob S.

description: My friend and I decided to grab a bite before we headed to our hotel. We apparently saw this restaurant because it was near our hotel, which is located near union square. We we're craving some breakfast items, so we headed to the diner. Despite being a busy Saturday, they were able to seat us in the next couple of minutes. The server was able to take our order quickly and efficiently. In addition, they were also kind. I ordered the ham omelet and my friend ordered the nachos supreme. My omelet was pretty good. It was nothing special, but tasted good. My friend in the other hand didn't like the way the nachos was made. It's different then what we are used to. The reason I gave it four stars is because the environment was unclean. All in all, the restaurant had good food and service that makes up for its eye sore look.
author: Lai S.

description: Gross! About sums it up. I read reviews and should of listened. It's pure diner sloop. If you go stick with toast and eggs. I had omelette that was gross,would of been ok but they drowned it in spaghetti sauce. Wife had another gross egg discovered in the same sauce. Yep pure corner diner sloop.  If you like that kinda thing this is your place. Service is poor too.
author: Cj J.

description:
Good food
Nice selection from omelets, waffles, a few vegetarian choices.
Pleasant staff
Fast

This place is open 25 hours 
The kitchen looks a bit messy likely because they are on the go all day !
Our table and seats were clean 
My silver ware needed a little wipe with the napkin
author: L H.

description: Wonderful well-oiled machine of a diner! I'm a vegan and my partner is not. He loves all things breakfast while I do not. Pinecrest was the perfect solution. We went for breakfast on a MondayI got the Organic Malibu with no cheese and a side of hash browns. The hash browns were half a plate full and while they don't season them, this I actually enjoyed. I'd rather salt and pepper them myself than have inedible super salty hash. The waitstaff was incredible - super friendly and they clearly do this all day, every day. Watching the cooks from the counter was like watching an army - everything was done with amazing precision. I was also impressed with the cleanliness of the entire place. Most diners have a greasy, sticky atmosphere, but everywhere I looked, including the cooking gear and side preps were clean. Overall a great breakfast experience!
author: Amber G.

description: Solid food for solid prices. Very much met my expectations for a diner in the middle of the city. Might have been a little short staffed for my experience, but the restaurant was certainly filled. Sat at the counter for a late dinner and it was satisfying to see the work being out into my quick meal.
author: Dennis S.

description:
I ordered Mix Fruit with Cottage Cheese, Bacon and two eggs (Sunny side up).
And my husband ordered New York Steak Dinner (Medium-rare).
It comes with Salad, and he chose thousand island dressing.
We also have coffee and ice tea.
Im telling you, it's our best meal in 2016.
This fucking place is better than Cheesecakefactory and California Kitchen.
Im in awe !!!!! 
When I got home, i was still licking the deliciousness that left between my teeh gap.
author: Chia C.

description:
If you are eating diner food near the Hilton in San Francisco, pick this one.

Reliable and low risk.  Minimal decorating but still a nice place to sit. 

Not terrible pricing.

A good place to get a reasonable utility meal while saving your pennies for your SF splurge.

Note the competing nearby diners have major landmines on the menu and questionable service - so this is your safe harbor.
author: Samuel C.

description: Cool little place and the food looked really good. Ordered a sandwich and sat at the counter. The only scary thing was watching the guy cook my food. Grabbed raw chicken and bacon and then avocado. Then reached in the cooler and grabbed cheese. Made burgers with his hands and plated other food without a glove. He wiped his hands on his pants over and over and that was it. After watching I paid for my food to go. Paid and threw it away after what I witnessed. Please someone get the cook a glove. Between all the raw meats and touching what I saw was at least 7 other orders of food. Scary.
author: Brett P.

description: This place is the worst, don't come here the coffee is better at Jack and the Box across the street as well for a greasy spoon they have no S.O.S. Which should be mandatory for any dinner in SF.
author: Andreas D.

description: Came for late breakfast on an non-busy day. I can see how service could be hit or miss, it's a small diner. Our service was fine, very quick on the drinks, a little slow on the orders, but we survived. I ordered the chorizo eggs, very good. However, the real standout was the toast; my son and I both ordered the sourdough toast, and they just nailed it.
author: Clare L.

description: I don't hold 24/7 diners to particularly high standards, and Pinecrest barely met them. The fries are fresh, but their texture is dramatically lacking: crispy-hard on the outside, potato powder on the inside.
author: John L.

description:
Terrible service. They had 3 free tables available and more people leaving from other tables and they made me wait 10 minutes because they "don't seat one person" except for at the bar which was full and no one was leaving.

I would have accepted a "we will seat you at a table for now but would move you to the bar once a seat becomes available"

But it was just a straight no despite me saying that I don't have time to wait. 

Nearby cafes were much better and more flexible.
author: Nicholas O.

description:
One huge complaint about this restaurant are the unsafe stairs going down to the bathroom. It was raining outside and the stairs were wet. They had NO nonslip applications on the first three steps. I put my foot down and fell three stairs down. It felt as if I had stepped in a pile of grease.  I hope have not broken my foot. 
The food was typical diner food. I thought the coffee tasted very burnt. 
Unfortunately my breakfast was ruined by the fall!!
author: Lori B.

description:
I arrived into town past midnight due to a delayed flight into SFO.  I was hungry enough to eat my shoes.  The front desk recommended this place to me.  Not much of anything is open late in San Francisco, so I took his advice.   

The place is typical 24-hour diner.  It is a no frills place with some typical late night diner strange types hanging around and eating.  I went the safe route and ordered a turkey club on sourdough toast.  They had one guy making the food and he was a machine, cranking out everything quickly.  My sandwich was very good - freshly grilled bacon and a fresh order of piping hot fries hit the spot.
author: Dan C.

description: I sampled all of the diners near Mason St/Union square, and this is the best by far. Do not be put off by the fact that it looks like the decor hasn't been updated since the 70s or that you might be kidnapped on your way to the bathroom in the basement- all is good here.  There was a bizarrely all-man staff each time I went, but they still managed to get the orders right, and serve fresh hot food quickly.  Coffee refill offers were plenty.  Beat dishes were the Belgian waffle mounded high with fruit, and the spinach omelette.  The place was clean and light, but not too bright . the baseroom bathrooms were clean and even had a baby changing table. I will return here every morning I am in the Union Square area- it is a real gem.
author: Maureen D.

description: I noticed Pinecrest when I was being dropped off at my hotel. The service was extremely fast, and the staff were very nice. The Hash Browns and Sourdough was awesome :). I would highly recommend it.
author: Alex C.

description:
Great diner near Union square. Small, classic feel. Great to sit at the counter and feel like you're in the 50's. Corned beef hash was great and a local classiç.

But, be prepared to wait during Large conferences. The staff does an absolutely phenomenal job clearing tables and making sure singles did at the counter (saving the booths for 2or mode). 

Prices are reasonable for the area but still still seem expensive to those from outside SF.

Highly recommend!
author: Phillip S.

description: I know their food has potential to be really great. But today i should've just went to Jack in the box across the street. I got nachos and the chips were so stale :(
author: Thanh N.

description: Went to Pinecrest for brunch with my family because it's only a block away from our hotel and we were curious about "the best breakfast in San Francisco" as it proclaimed. The food was OK although they were in really big portions. The staff wasn't very friendly and the biggest throw-off was that 15% tips were already included in the bill.
author: Si-Han C.

description:
After asking around for a good diner to enjoy some breakfast, we ended up at the Pinecrest Diner. It's the typical diner (very busy with a line out the door) and has a great breakfast. We were seated right near the door which got annoying considering people were always flying in and out, but I guess that's just the charm of eating at a busy diner in town. 

The food was good! Nothing that makes is very special, but still a meal that I was happy with. I had toast, bacon, eggs and hashbrowns for about $10. 

Now onto the negative... There were four of us at the table and I was the only one not drinking coffee. When I got my bill, I noticed I was charged for one. I went up to the register and our same waitress rang me up. I explained how the coffee shouldn't be on my bill and she kept checking over to the table as if I was lying. Then she said to me "Well, somebody is going to have to pay for the coffee." Um, obviously lady. Put the coffee on their bill. They drank it.
