After, another person from my party went up to pay for the remaining meals (and coffees!!). She scolded him about the coffee and thought we were trying to steal a freakin' coffee! Really, woman? You are going to be THAT stubborn over $2 when this place is booming with business. It's your mistake! Rather than just simply saying "Okay, I'll add the coffee to your bill," she was very unprofessional. 

Food was good. Service needs improvement.
author: Aj S.

description: Not sure why there was a line out the door at 1030am, except almost everyone there was a tourist. The food is OK but the service was disappointing and waiting in line really took the enjoyment out of eating here.  I would not go back here when there are so many other options.
author: Brekkie D.

description:
Great breakfast place the owner Pete  is pleasure to speak with. Very nice guy.  
Nadia is such a hard working waitress,  my first time seeing someone use calculator two handed.
author: Danny S.

description: Very average diner. Food was subpar, and the restaurant itself is a bit dirty. Since the place is so small, they don't have a lot of space, so we were sitting very close to bins of dirty dishes...not very appealing.
author: Karina M.

description: Old style short order. What's not to like? No pretending or imitating here, this is the real thing. I love that it's open 24/7, and serves any meal at any time. Opened in 1969, this truly authentic blast from the past could just as easily be from the 40s or 50s. Fast service, generous portions, and good ole' food. Older and wiser cousins of roadside Waffle Houses, diners like this are from an era of vastly under appreciated American cuisine. There is something deeply nostalgic to see men lined up on stools, chowing down at the counter (although the clientele is often much younger!).
author: Mark W.

description:
My friends and I had breakfast there the other day and the service was phenomenal!!! We where so pleased with our lovely server. I don't remember her name but she had the cutest accent and she told us she was Russian. 
Service is quick and friendly 
Food is delicious!!! I had the country fried steak and I'm pretty petite never really finish my whole food but I SURE DID finish my steak.
I highly recommend...
author: Mila A.

description:
The all American breakfast place for all too much cash.

It's greasy, portions are decent, tasty, it's noisy and busy, menu is okay, but I didn't like that an omelette platter with a side of bacon and a cup of burnt drip coffee outrageously goes for $25 USD plus tax, plus tip. Maybe it's just me that thinks that upwards $30 USD should go a longer way for a weekday breakfast, maybe it's just a tourist trap. 

This is a 24/7 diner style spot. Very casual. If you're alone there are a few spots on the bar. Waiting staff is very nice. Cooks are quick and the kitchen works well to serve your meal fast and yummy. 

Don't count on a good coffee here. Get your fix across the street at Starbucks (drip coffee with refills is $2.50, and not included with your meal). 

If you don't want your toast dripping with unidentifiable fatty substance - you have to ask (they don't check with you). Be ready to write off the calories, nothing here is on the low fat side unless you take fruit. 

I had the Spanish omelette which is stuffed with cheese. Comes with hash browns on the side and some avocado and salsa on top. Very tasty.

I saw the pancakes and they are big and look good. Many people ordered pancake platters here. 

Location-wise, rather central and easy to find.
author: Morenita C.

description:
Our Mozzarrella Stick Craving Satisfaction Stop For Midnight And After!

SITREP

It's indeed a "diner" - just as the word used in it's name says it is. But there are different metrics for me when I review a place between the hours of Midnight and 4am.  

THE SETUP

What might merely be a 3-Star or even 2.5-Star establishment at Noon becomes a 4-Star place for me because:  (1)  It's open at 2AM; AND, (2) It has great mozzarrella sticks.

OUR CRAVINGS

My sweet friend Diana and I will finish a club-dancing regimen and then we are looking for munchies, and whaddaya know - Pinecrest Diner is OPEN and it has Mozzarella sticks - Stringy, Crispy, Fried Cheese Sticks with Marinara Sauce for only $6.95 a large order.  

Add in 1 or 2 Lemonades ($2.25) and/or Milk Shakes ($4.25) and/or Malts ($4.75), then our "Wee Hours of the Mornin'" cravings are resolved.

PARKING

Sucks hamsters.  This is right near Ruby Skye and in the vicinity of Union Square, so you're better off if you BART'd / Muni'd in or walked.  Just sayin.  [Kinda defeats the purpose of having cheap munchies if you get nailed for $10 or more in Parking fees, right?]

THE LOWDOWN

It has the munchies we want at 2AM.
author: Michelangelo S.

description:
Stopped for breakfast this AM and a late dinner a couple of days ago. Both times I ordered the same thing and was super pleased with the results.  
Bacon and cheese omelette was full of crisp bacon, hash brown potatoes were light and crisp and the sour dough bread was awesome.  Good staff, lightning fast service at the counter, a little bit slower at night in a booth.  
Small place so you may have to wait for a booth or seat but definitely worth a try.
author: Philip L.

description: Located along all of the other late night diners on Mason Street, Pinecrest Diner is definitely the best one. Though the diner itself is pretty small and can get cramped when filled with people, it produces some of the best food on the block. The quality of their ingredients is definitely better than the other diners on the block. Not only is their food on point, but the service was amazing. We had such a sweet and nice server, who always checked in on us and made sure everything was on point. As for the food, their portions are huge, filling, delicious and reasonably priced. Overall, if you are searching for some good eats any time of day, then definitely check-out Pinecrest Diner.
author: Cristal C.

description:
Pinecrest is one of my favourite breakfast places in downtown SF. 
My favourite is sitting at one of the bar stools that overlook the busy kitchen, and watch the eggs and pancakes being fried on giant hot plate. They have a huge bucket of pancake mix and a tray filled with like 100 eggs. Everything is industrial size here. Check. Many of the kitchen and waiting staff exchange some light-hearted remarks with each other in Spanish. Check. 
The kitchen seems always busy but the service is quick. Just what you need to start your day. 
The pancakes might not be as good as Lori's just across the road. But this place looks more down to earth and fit for everyday use. I like to come here and make believe that this is my daily routine, and that I'm perfectly blending into the beat of this town. But in reality, I think it's obvious to everyone that I'm just a foreigner. 
Another important point to note. Bills tend to come out a bit cheaper than Lori's. 
Also. This place has a cash point inside.
author: Leo U.

description: I guess it's good for breakfast but definitely not to have a healthy salad for lunch. I had the taco salad and it was sooo greasy I couldn't eat half of it. It tasted Ok but I guess anything with that much cheese in it will taste good!
author: Yas T.

description: Saw this place and it was busy. Ordered tuna sandwich, fried shrimp and fried chicken. Not fresh at all. Would've gone to jack n the box across the street instead. We didn't even get water refill. Not coming back.
author: bien c.

description: I give this place 4 stars because if you are looking for a typical breakfast place this is it. Close to our hotel and shopping. Fast to get seated, fast service. Food is as expected...typical hashbrowns, eggs, meat, pancakes, etc. Nothing special but sometimes all you want is that classic breakfast. They were on the pricey side, but not sure if that is because we are in the heart of San Fran.
author: Alaina C.

description:
Great place for breakfast! Good good and fast service. 

Their homemade salsa is very delicious and fresh.
author: Liz H.

description:
Pinecrest Diner is has a nice setting and clean tables. We had good customer service, and our food was fresh and warm. We ordered a belgian waffle, (which is enough for one person) and a bacon avocado cheeseburger with side fries that I highly recommend if you're feeling hungry. 

I would come back for more
author: Martha S.

description:
Staying at the nearby Westin for work I tried Pinecrest this morning for breakfast.  It was not bad but it was also not memorable in anyway.  I arrived right around 7am and things were pretty busy.   Sitting at the counter it took about 5 mins before I got coffee.  My denver omelet came relatively quickly after that.  The omelet was ok.  but the accompanying homefries were pretty gross.  They were the frozen variety (I watched the cook take them out of the freezer bag and onto his grill).

I guess my breakfast at Pinecrest sort of reminded me of Denny's... except 2x the price.  Maybe this is the cost of San Francisco living?  

Lori's across the street is about the same price but better tasting food in my opinion.
author: Brian P.

description: We entered the restaurant around 1pm during our baby was taking a nap. The perfect time to enjoy a meal when we are parent. The waitress asked us to fold our baby stroller although there was enough room to leave it open. I refused to awake my baby, so she barely asked us to leave without naming it. So we left... rude... they will never see us again
author: Sarah S.

description: My wife and I came here because it was close to our hotel. After reading the reviews I was hoping for a much better experience. Unfortunately this place was barely edible and way over priced. We decided to split the pinecreast special and 2 coffees, and ended up paying $30 for food we barely touched. The coffee was watered down as well. All and all not even mediocre , and with all the options around here you would be better off anywhere else.
author: Forest W.

description: Family favorite- we went multiple times on our trip. Friendly service and good breakfast. There was a rush for breakfast, but wait time is reasonable. Bacon and cheese omelet was my favorite. Hash browns are delicious.
author: Rachel O.

description:
A great place, very simple no nonsense establishment! 

I sat along the counter directly in front of the grille. Watching the synchronized movements of the cooks was very entertaining and amazing! All business approach and most of the orders were prepared in a efficient manner. Most of the dishes were out in about 15 mins.

Satisfied my "grease" fix with a Fried Chicken order that came with 4pcs, side veggies and mash potatoes with brown gravy! The veggies were excellent, not mushy and lightly seasoned with salt after being sautéed in some butter.

This is a wonderful place to cure a hangover! Food portions a very generous, so I would consider sharing if you dont want to experience that over-stuffed, unbutton your pants feeling!
author: Dalmacio C.

description: Undecided on where to eat we stumbled in to Pinecrest Diner for lunch. We were not disappointed with our Club House and Reuben sandwiches and found the staff to be very prompt and friendly. I definitely recommend stopping by for a delicious lunch!
author: Noah S.

description:
We love eating here... The service is efficient (if you get Christina, she is better than efficient and has a great personality too!). The food is VERY GOOD- quick, made right, and extra tasty after an evening at the bar. The place isn't anywhere to go for visual satisfaction, but it's the best diner in that area-- you know what you will get will be tasty. My husband gets the avocado burger and I go for the BLT!  Also, their mozz sticks are amazing. 
There is no waiting area, so if you go and have to wait- be prepared to stand in a confined area. The bathroom is located a couple flights of stairs down, but hey at least they have one (common in that area not to have one or to have to get a code or a coin).  Prices are great.
author: Kristen G.

description: Best breakfast and WORTH the wait! Pinecrest gives you the home and comfortable feeling. The service was good and attentive. We ordered Belgian waffles, huevos rancheros, and spanish omelette. Omelette was amazing to the point where once it hit your tongue, it melted. Belgian waffles was good as it should be. And hues rancheros was amazing as well. Each of these dishes definitely lived up to its expectations. I would suggest this place to anyone who goes here.
author: Jenesha M.

description:
The busboy beckoned me to the counter.  He also worked the cash register.  After waiting 20 minutes, the cook finally took my order.  I'm not sure what the waitresses are for, other than slapping your check down without even acknowledging your existence.

I was seated in the middle of the counter, which is the spot they've chosen to refill the shakers, napkin dispensers, ketchup bottles, etc.  I hope that I didn't get in their way too much.

Waffles and two eggs over medium.  Waffles were slightly browner and warmer than the plate, and about as absorbent.  "Over medium" apparently translates as "egg soup."  For over-easy they probably bring out the chicken.  That, and a glass of tepid milk in a scratched-up plastic cup, is over $15.

The perfect place if you're desperate for breakfast at any price and have Social Anxiety Disorder.  Otherwise, cross the street to Jack In The Box, which is fucking Moulin Rouge compared to here.
author: Edward L.

description:
I am excited to be back in the Bay Area. My wife and I arrived yesterday late and we're looking forward to waking up to a great breakfast before we started our journey . The pine crest diner was recommended by the the concierge at our hotel , the westin. 
We took them up on there recommendation and found the ambience very appealing . Unfortunately, everything went downhill from there. The service was atrocious to say the least . I am a restauranteur, 37 years , and I will tip at least 10% for the basic service . I couldn't even get myself to do that . Karla took our order ( memory ) and missed on a few requests . We had to remind her after requesting things twice . She was never apologetic and shall we say didn't bring a personality to work . The food was good and prompt. 
I strongly recommend you evaluate her if you care about delivering best in class. Let's hope she was just having a bad day because she would be a detriment to any restaurant . 
I can be reached for further comment . 
Thank you for your time .
author: Lee K.

description: Great omelettes. Hash browns are a staple especially on busy mornings where the volume lends an excellent consistency to what comes off the grill. No frills and often crowded with tourists staying near Union Square.
author: Dave B.

description:
We are visiting San Francisco for a couple of days and it has been nothing but great to us! Me and my boyfriend came across this place on Tuesday nights we were looking for somewhere to go eat so we went in although there was kind of a small line but we still waited because we were hungry. We were surprised because the place is small but the food is amazing and portions are good size and for being in downtown sf the prices are fair. we really loved the food as well as the service so we decided to come back and try breakfast. It was very tasty too!! For our luck, we had the same server as we had the night before. Our waitress Karla was very friendly to us, she gave us good recommendations. She was also very attentive, refilling our coffee, checking up on us and bringing all our food on time. overall I loved it and this is why I gave 5 stars.
we will definitely come back next time we are here again! If you happen to be in the area go and try this place out.
author: Angie J.

description: OMG!  Down-home cooking done right!  Exhausted and unable to check into my hotel in the afternoon, I was delightfully surprised to stumble upon the Pinecrest Diner.  This is the real deal - a truly down-home diner experience.  The Pinecrest Diner is open 24-h a day and offers a wide range of breakfast, lunch, and dinner options.  You can choose from any of their meal options anytime of the day.  I ended up being so pleased with my first visit that I found myself coming back at least four times over the next few days just to explore their ample menu.  Honestly, you can't go wrong with anything on their menu but I am going to single out their breakfast items because breakfast is my favorite meal and I often find it difficult to find places that don't charge an arm and a leg and deliver a high quality breakfast.   All their egg dishes come with the most delightful crispy and not at all greasy hash brown potatoes.  The omelets are all thoroughly cooked without being rubbery or dry.  The portions are truly generous and all of the omelets are 3-egg dishes.  Their pancakes are huge, fluffy and delicious even without the warm syrup that they serve with it.  I have saved the best for last - they serve a rich dark roast coffee and they continuously refresh your cup during the meal.
author: Patricia M.

description: There's much to be desired here. However, it is your typical diner. The place wasn't too busy when I came yet the floors were a mess and many tables hadn't been cleaned off. It's very small & they have a minimum purchase per person. They also charge for sharing plates. They mention they're known for their burgers? I'm not sure why. They aren't seasoned or special. Service was ok. I like that they verify your ID with your card. The food is bland. They could get seasoning salt for their fries and/or burgers. It would help. Also if they maybe got gluten free buns or bread, it would be nice.
author: Jessica H.

description: *CAUTION* worst diner I have ever been to in my life. Service was extremely slow, food was not fully cooked and tasted terrible. On top of that they overcharged my bill. Manager was extremely rude when correcting the bill and did not correct it l, giving me lip while she did it.Would not recommend to anyone. Loris is right across the street and beats pinecrest's terrible food and service any day. Beware if u go there of getting ripped off. Also reported to the better business bureau of SF! Hope this was helpful!
author: Cole L.

description: Yummy breakfast food, great portions. The food is well seasoned, the sourdough toast is really fresh & buttery. I would recommend this diner for groups of 4 or smaller, the ambiance is casual. Service isn't too bad, once our order was in the food came pretty fast. If you're in the area this is a good place for breakfast!
author: Ashley C.

description:
Solid "greasy spoon". Nothing fancy. Decent food (not spectacular). Always consistent and comes out quick and hot. 

I've only had breakfast here and would probably venture elsewhere for lunch. 

You won't be blown away but you will get a hot tasty meal pretty quickly.
author: Michael O.

description: I hate it when you order a bowl fruit and all they give you is melon and a few strawberries. This place however had the best fresh fruit. The rest of our breakfast was fairly standard, nothing amazing but it was good. It's a small spot on the corner. The waitress forgot my husbands coffee so we went across the street to Starbucks. Probably wouldn't return on our next visit to SF simply because there are many other diners near by.
author: Ilene H.

description: I came here because of the reviews. But boy was I let down. First thing I noticed walking in, stacks of dirty dishes right by the entrance for everybody to see that's walking in. It honestly killed a bit of my appetite. Then I look at the staff. They were all over the place. It wasn't even that busy to begin with. But it looked like a total sh*t show. I decided to stay to try the food. I was seated at the very back. First thing i noticed was the smell. It literally smelled as if a homeless person spent the night there and urinated on the floor. It was honestly unbearable. To make matters worse, the utensils were dirty and the fork still had some left over food stuck on it. I couldn't handle it anymore. I simply walked out. I have never ever walked out before. Maybe I came on a bad day, I don't know. All I know is that it was simply the worst dining experience I have ever had. I didn't even want to order food.
author: Luis N.

description: 24/7 Breakfast that wouldn't let you down. A classic American diner you would see in the movies or series, running by the backbone.of unite states --- latinos.
author: Mouyi C.

description: Based off of a late night 24 hour breakfast joint, this is the one besides cafe mason!
author: Justin M.

description:
This is a review of an amalgamation of many late night visits to Pinecrest Diner.

I know not everyone agrees.  But, I have always loved this place.

I do not think I have ever been in the daytime.  It was close to my last apartment in San Francisco.  So, it was my designated late night spot for a burger or a breakfast.

http://tinyurl.com/d6frl67

I think they do a fine diner version of both.  The staff was always friendly to me.  I always found the diner to be clean.  I often here folks say it is dirty.  I just never really found that to be true.  But, then again, I may just be comparing it to the neighbourhood surrounding it.  Either way, it was never dirty enough to send me running.

Plus, it is often populated with a clientele as colourful as the  Pincecrest's notorious past.

I am sure that someday (ok some late night) I will find myself chowing down on a late night breakfast or burger again at Pincecrest Diner.  It is truly a San Francisco institution.
author: Mark D.

description: My daily b'fast place whenever I'm in SF. This must've been what it was like to visit a diner in the 70's. Good, honest, tasty comfort food 24/7. Affordable and always filling. You'll never go wrong here.
author: A Y.

description: This used to be a great place for a burger late at night. No more. The place continually changes owners, and you can tell. The place was packed with tourists the other night, and I thought I'd chance it. When you see only one waiter, you know it's going to be trouble. It took forever for the food to get there. Such a bad vibe as everyone was ticked off and complaining. Never again.
author: Michael F.

description: Came here for breakfast on a Sunday! While the diner is tiny, seating only took about 15mins. I had the Pinecrest special which included 2 pancakes 2eggs 2 links and 2 bacon for about $14 with orange juice which was $4 ok I guess considering it was about $6  just for a side of eggs and about $9 for side of pancakes. One thing I found odd is that they charge $7 if you decide to share a plate I've never heard of such thing before. Food was good but service was ehh! Never asked if we needed Refills or anything else, once our server brought our food we never saw her again until she brought out our check which was about $40 for two breakfast plates and 2 drinks. 3 stars only because food was good and seating was quick
author: Daisy A.

description: The best Belgium waffles ! The only thing I don't like is that it gets pretty stuffy and the service is slow other than that the best breakfast
author: Shaubnem Q.

description:
No better place in SF for Classic American diner menu, staff and ambience. 

Breakfast is served all day and I rarely pass up the corned beef hash. When I do order something else, it's usually the chicken fried steak. And, don't forget the chocolate shake. Yes, it's all right to order a shake for breakfast.

But, whatever you do, be prepared for incredibly slow service. The owners refuse to properly staff the joint and everything from getting a table to placing an order to getting an order to paying a bill is extremely SSSLLLOOOOWWW.
author: David B.

description: Our favorite spot! We live in San Jose and we go up to San Francisco 3 times a week. Every time we're in San Francisco, we have to have a meal at this diner because the food is so amazing!
author: S J.

description: Really good 24/7 diner place near Union Square. I had the Chicken Fried Steak and Eggs with delicious gravy, buttery scrambled eggs, and soft well-cooked hash browns.
author: Shih Fa K.

description:
Pinecrest is to die for. Been going for years. 
Go at 2:00-3:00am on a Friday/Saturday night and it's worth the price of admission alone just for the entertainment factor.
Once I saw a woman get up, stand on the seat to climb over her friend in order to get out of the booth. 
Instead of just having him move. She was wearing insanely tall stiletto's & pulled it off without a hitch. 
I have heard 14 different languages spoken while eating there over the years. 

Breakfast Breakfast Breakfast. There is no place that has a swiss cheese & mushroom omelet like Pinecrest. NOWHERE!
The salad's are huge, fresh & fantastic.
I have never once taken somebody there & they weren't happy & completely satisfied upon leaving..

I love you Pinecrest. 
San Francisco staple. Beautiful inside, cool as hell how the windows sit above the street, beautiful wood & light fixture's, awesome food, big big portions, staff is hardworking, booth's/table's/floor always clean.
Ive only waited in a line once. All this time, it was once.

Love you

Love you   xox
author: A L.

description: If you are hungry for a substantial breakfast, try this place. Delicious and a real diner experience.
author: Kelley B.

description: Amazingly fast service and nice staff! The food was good too, not amazing but still good. The Greek omlet had way too much feta cheese but was still good.
author: Emily P.

description: Great place. Great food. Great show. Come here every time I come to SF. Love it. Hot link and eggs are amazing.
author: Garry B.

description: Good greasy/hangover style food but the most uncomfortable place I have ever tried to eat at. It ok if you get one of the very few tables with chairs but the booths and counter are painful.
author: Chris G.

description: Great food in a very small diner. Good service and perfect for a meal in the middle of the financial distr
author: Daniel R.

description: Rude waiters - only seating at a bar with Zero elbow room if you are single. A ridiculous place to eat if you want to be treated with respect and dignity.
author: Ric B.

description: We saw the sign about San Francisco's best breakfast , they were right! It was great ... Coffee was fresh, hot and kept coming. We ordered Pinecrest's special ; best of both world's eggs and pancakes or French toast. You don't have to order separate! The only reason I gave it 4 stars was I wish the place was bigger... Kind of crammed but the wait wasn't bad at all. We will definitely be back and recommend ...
author: Darla R.

description:
Arrived in SFO the night before and we wanted somewhere to grab breakfast (having suffered jet lag and been up since 5am).  A true American Diner - pancakes plenty and omelette was great.  We were there early but by the time we left there was a queue.

Well priced and good start to our trip in SFO.
author: Laurence K.

description:
Pinecrest Diner is one of the best unknown gems in San Francisco.  It's a classic "Sleepy Diner" style place, with that Truck-stop kind of charm (and their hours of operation are unbeatable).  All of their food is outstanding.  I've tried only a few of their menu items.  I've enjoyed everyone of them.  But...

The Burgers.  I've had burgers.  List up: All fast food joint's (McD, BK, Wen, JiB, I&O, 5G's), love the "Latenight" stands (1/4 Lb shout), etc.  There are all manner of burger joint's in the area (Lori's can just shut down for all I care).  You could hit Pearls, or Super Duper.  Scala's has a Bistro style that's appreciable.  It's all good, and it comes down to what you're in the mood for.  Pinecrest Diner is simply outstanding.  They have never failed to satisfy my craving for a classic flame broiled patty on a toasted bun, made to order.  And - the French Fries rock as well (as do the fresh made Onion Rings).  

Go ahead.  Treat yourself.  Pinecrest makes good food!
author: Scott H.

description:
They made me a fantastic raw vegan spinach salad at 2 AM... I definitely believe that deserves 5 stars. 

The cooked food eaters that I was with were all very happy about their omelet's and such. 

I like this late night spot!
author: Monica H.

description: Really good diner. We ordered the House Omlette which was extremely tasty. The service was friendly and fast. Would have rated higher if the pancakes were better-they were a little gummy. I like mine fluffier. Overall excellent choice for breakfast. Highly reccommend.
author: Rika C.

description:
I've been here a few times and the food has always been consistent.  I'm a greasy spoon die hard, and Pinecrest did not fail me!

Whenever I'm craving breakfast for lunch, this is where I go to.  Unfortunately, I went here one time for breakfast during the AM and it's just insanely busy with a long wait.  Quite the opposite for lunch hour as I've always walked in and was immediately seated.

They make a solid corned beef hash, eggs, with hash browns; CBH and HB cooked exactly how I like it, well done!  Not many greasy spoons know how to cook my ideal hash browns, all golden and crispy throughout, love it!  My check usually comes out to $18 w/tax and tip.

Service has always been friendly and they've managed to always keep my beverage full.  Also, if you manage to snag a large booth, it's great for people watching.

One thing that I don't like, I guess it depends on the server, but one time, I got a rubber stamp on my check that said something to the effect of, "Does not include tip!"  I was a little offended but then I got to thinking, it's probably meant for the tourists, perhaps?

Overall, nice spot, and best part, you won't smell like bacon grease after you leave!

#EatingBreakfastForLunchIsRad
author: Nick D.

description:
The diner is very typical. I was looking for an American diner and I found this thanks to Yelp. It's very central! 

We ordered 2 burgers for  11.90$ each and the chicken breast. The waitress was very kind.. Everything was fine! 
Try it!
author: Ele A.

description:
Order the omelet.  They are huge and delicious.   There was a short wait even though the place was packed.  Nice mix of locals and tourists.  Staff is friendly and place is clean.

The food came out fast and was prepared and served as ordered.  Zero complaints.
author: Raul R.

description:
this place is my new go to breakfast stop! Such great food and nice folks behind the counter. 

The hot links are great! Just the right heat.
author: john W.

description:
Came here seeking a quick snack before we hit the town and was pleasantly surprised. There isn't anything overly special about the food (our chicken tenders & fries tasted like they could've been store bought frozen ones. Not that there's anything wrong with that per say) but the fresh cooked chicken breast on our mixed greens salad was steaming and delicious. 

The atmosphere of the diner is what made it for me. It really felt like stepping back in time and just gave the whole thing so much charm. Around us were sitting a couple of people who were clearly regulars which is also a good sign in my opinion. 

Glad we chose here versus the Ruby's/Johnny Rockets style 50s diner across the street. Pinecrest definitely had some authentic charm to it and a friendly wait staff.
author: Conor B.

description: Excellent Niman Ranch burgers, great coffee, and yummy milkshakes. We make a point of coming here every time we visit SF.
author: Jeffrey C.

description: The coffee is amazing. Had three cups and wanted more. Had a spinach, tomato, avocado and cheese omelet and it was delicious. I didn't really see what the big hype was on the hash browns - they seemed pretty average to me. Overall, I highly recommend!
author: Lauren G.

description: Great service ! This is a cute diner with a full range of food . Our waiter was so nice and it seemed he was working alone. We had dinner around 1130 pm and it was quiet busy. We had the spicy chicken sand which with sweet potato fries and it hit the spot. Definitely a must try. Great for late at night..24/7.
author: Kaylin C.

description: Watching the 5-6 person team in the morning is seeing a well oiled machine in action. Great breakfast food of the standard American diner variety. Friendly staff who know what they are doibg.
author: Carolyn M.

description: Best dining experience I had in the two days I visited the city!! Great food great staff old school style. Eat here you won't be disappointed!!!
author: Shanon R.

description:
Se had breakfast in that dinner.the food was good and the size of  dishes is fine.
How ever it was one of the most expensive breakfast that we had. We paid 38$ for salad, oete and 2 regular coffees.
author: Tali R.

description: Kinda awesome place to grab breakfast at 1 in the morning. I recommend the Spanish omelette
author: Alfie F.

description: What more can you ask for (besides half a vintage Chevy poking out the front) in a diner?  Excellent friendly service, great food (yes, get the pancakes), bottomless coffee. Hits the spot.
author: David W.

description: I visited this classic dinner late Friday night because it was recommended by some locals.  If you are into the vintage/classic style diners (as I am), then you will love the decor and ambiance of this place with the booths, the casual atmosphere and the friendly service.  Our orders were a bit hit and miss though.  Some of us ordered the clam chowder and it seemed to have a bit of a sour after taste to it.  I ordered the cobb salad and while the portions is very generous, the chicken on it had a very odd/weird aftertaste.  Another friend ordered the turkey omelet and another ordered the patty melt.  Both of these items were very good and are up to expectations of what you would expect from a classic diner.  All in all.. ok.  Just wasn't quite blown away.
author: Matthew C.

description: Stella on tap. Chilled glasses. Nice open face chili burger cooked to order. Just a block off Union Square in the wrong direction. I've also been here several times for breakfast. Much bigger crowds in early AM. Lots of searing for lunch.
author: Bill F.

description:
For the convenience Pinecrest is a go place for me since I work at union square.  I have been visiting this restaurant almost every 2 days for a long time.  
Strangely it started from this week, one of the waitress started to include the tips on the credit card merchant copy without informing me.  I did not bother to ask her why until today.  Because I noticed that she is the only waitress who includes tips in the credit card copy w/o telling the customers.  I asked her today and she said it just a suggested amount.  "NO".  you run it thru credit card machine and it is no longer "suggested amount".  I had her re-run.  

PRO - 
1. food comes fast.
2. price is reasonable at union square
3. good hashbrown
4. lots fruit on waffle


CON - 
1. service is not that friendly and good.  
2. coffee is like water
3. need to pay attention to what you are billed for
4. too much butter on the toast. It makes the toast soggy.
author: Louise T.

description: My wife and I had breakfast here. Our waitress, Christina, suggested the Spanish Omelette. It was AWESOME!! I understand why there is usually a line to get in. I'll be back whenever I'm in San Francisco.
author: Jay M.

description: This review is for tourists, apparently San Francisco is a haven for homeless people, which is fine. I just don't care to have homeless wiping down tables and picking up tables where I eat. Three of us came here to eat breakfast and saw an individual that was not an employee handling silverware, plates and cleaning tables that had very questionable hygiene standards. This place seems to be ok with this since they allowed it and fed him. I'm sorry, but I expect a certain level of cleanliness when it comes to food.
author: EDGAR G.

description: As I was walking through SF last night, I came across this diner and decided to go there for breakfast today. Pinecrest is a cool little diner. I took time to look through the menu and found a dish that caught my eye. Joe's Special was a scramble with hamburger, spinach, and onions. It was a great choice and it felt like a dish I may have in Florence, Italy instead of SF. A great way to start the day!
author: Gary G.

description:
The food here is 3-stars, but the waitress that we've had every time we come here is probably the sweetest person you'll ever meet at a restaurant like this. I'm not going to elaborate on why I say this, but you'll know when you meet her why I do. On to the restaurant...

The menus are faded and the place isn't the cleanest (the bathrooms are two staircases below the restaurant and are pretty nasty) but the food is pretty darn good. The exterior leaves a lot to be desired, but don't let the facade fool you. I've learned to never judge a book by its cover! 

It's your typical cafe food with a slight twist on some breakfast options but the menu is very extensive and everything is fresh and prepared perfectly. 
My first time here, we started with the appetizer sampler and it came out piping hot and tasted great. I had the Pinecrest Omelet twice and it has definitely become my fave here - it's loaded with ingredients and the eggs are so fluffy! The hashbrowns are cooked to absolute perfection; golden brown on the outside and soft on the inside. My husband had the chicken-fried steak with fries and he enjoyed it. 

I've seen people from every walk of life at this restaurant and they seem to have an option for everyone; even vegans. A gem in the heart of the city!
author: Patricia W.

description: Great diner in a great location. Great coffee, great food. Ample proportions. What's not to like?
author: Robert M.

description: Get anything, as long as it doesn't have cooking restrictions that might make you vomit. Sickest I've been at a restaurant ever.
author: Shaun P.

description:
After a week of eating overly fancified hotel sandwiches, my colleague and I just wanted something simple. And not in a box.  We were staying at different hotels and Pinecrest was our in-between place.  We threw in our sweats, hats and were ready to laugh and eat hearty food that felt like home.

Our host immediately made us feel comfy and guided us to a booth near the door.  Waving off the occasional homeless person, wasn't enough to distract us from the vastness of the menu.  Seriously.  Spaghetti. Burgers & Fries.  Greek. Belgian Waffles. Whatever your drunk little tummy desires, Pinecrest has it.

I ordered the Chicken & Pita while my friend ordered a burger.  The chicken was grilled nicely and tzatziki sauce was mild and tasty.  Pita tasted like it was out of a bag, but, for a diner, it wasn't too bad.  We developed a jovial *ahem* relationship with our server and he gave us our banana split gratis.  

For a homey, fun, relaxing break from all the fru-fru; Pinecrest Diner is a marvelous alternative.
author: Jenn M.

description: This place was okay. The service was great but I found my corned beef hash a little bit greasy although they did put lots of cheese on top like I asked. I like their French Toast though. I like the ambiance which is a classic diner feel with the open kitchen so you can see and smell the food that they're making. It's open 24-hours so they got errbody and they momma up in here from all walks of life. I'll probably eat here again one day.
author: Candice J.

description: Was staying across the street at nearby hotel & of course this place was open at 3am when we were starving! We called ahead and ordered wings and sweet potatoe fries.. Both were surprisingly very good... Staff were super friendly.. From the nice blonde chick who took our order to the guys in the kitchen who came out and spoke.. Next time we come to this area we will dine in. Wasn't entirely too clean, but I would still come back.
author: Mal M.

description: My sister and I ate here our first night in San  Francisco, we had asked a desk clerk at our hotel to  give us the name of a diner and she mentioned this place as being pretty good.There was a good size line at the door but it moved pretty fast and we were seated within 10 minutes,  We both ordered the fried chicken meal, omg it was so good.  We took the left overs, whichj was a lot, we got four pieces of chicken and couldnt eat that much at one time, back to the hotel and snacked on it during our stay,  I have seen some people saying the service was bad, I thought the service was fine, in fact more than one person came over as the place was packed, and helped the waitress out,  I have no complaints about this place, I did think it was a little pricey, but considering its in Union Square it wasnt out of line,  I would be more than happy to eat here again, delish
author: dorothy e.

description:
After a great night of bar hoping in SF, we were looking for a place to satisfy our need for grub and lard.. Pinecrest seemed as the ideal candidate.

The food was at best below mediocre and the service acceptable. What really bumped me off was the fact that although I ordered a patty melt 13.95$ that promised a 1/2 patty, when the dish arrived it was clear that it was only a 1/3 of a pound. And although a 1/6 of a pound difference might seem to some people as insignificant I felt disrespected and insulted. 

When I politely pointed out the fact to the waitress she indignantly denied it right away. She could at least check with the chef beforehand giving the customer the benefit of a doubt. At this point I need to stress that we didn't request any sort of rebate or discount when making our complaint and that we fully paid the check including tip.

Being in the bay area for a while I have eaten at The Counter enough times to know the difference between a 1/2 pound patty and a 1/3 and I believe that it is more likely that the owners of the restaurant are trying to squeeze some extra profit from tired, hang-over'd patrons late in the morning than us wanting to cause trouble after having a great night out.

(So great that we even rejected cocaine when it was offered to us by a random girl).

Friendly advice: go somewhere else if you want consistency in what you pay for and what you get.
author: Pari S.

description:
We stopped in for a late nite bite after string in San Fran for a weekend get away. Read some to the reviews before heading over from our hotel and read the mixed reviews and thought it was worth the shot to try it.
After being somewhat surprised that the menu was a bit limited for what I would classify as a great diner menu, they have the basics covered.
Staff was friendly but at times seems to be unorganized and understaffed for the diners this nite, but the food quality was good and tasted great so I'd say it was a wash.
 Defiantly the essence of the decor and environment made you feel like you were in the 1970's, but I gotta admit I really like places like that even the smell of the wood paneling grabs you when enter the place, flashback to den in the house where I grew up in NY!
To the owner(s) - Ya got a real gem of a place and with a little polish (TLC) for your patrons you'll always strike a home run!
author: Joe R.

description: Cute little diner open 24/7 in the heart of Union Square. Stopped in for a late night ice cream sundae and coffee. Really yummy and decently priced!
author: Michelle B.

description: The only place we could find that opened at 1030pm, it was a old fashioned place but food was amazing . I had the grilled chicken pesto and it was good, the serving size was big too, couldn't finish half of it. My friends ordered bacon mac and cheese , and it was one of the best mac n cheese I ever had. The other one ordered spaghetti and she said it was good too. The cashier lady wasn't the greatest. Just double check your ticket and how much she charged you for. Overall, food was great though.
author: Delena N.

description: If I can I wanna give them 0 star instead. We came here in the early morning for breakfast . Food is just so so, and not clean. I have found a hair inside my plate. VERY VERY VERY bad service as well. When we came in there is just one couple in front of us, then came in many groups behind us. They let us wait 20 minutes for the table but some body else later came in but earlier being seated just because they have more people in the group. At the end of the breakfast, they gave me the bill added 15% tips without any notice! ARE YOU KIDING ME! RODE! Never come back! No recommend! The WORST WORST WORST restaurant at all!
author: Dandan Z.

description: Reminds me of the Pantry in Los Angeles near the LA convention center. Fast and simple diner fare.
author: William P.

description:
I think this place deserves a better rating. We went after closing time at 2 a.m. on a Friday night/Saturday morning. It was busy with the bar crowd. The service was fast and friendly. The food was quite good for classic diner food. My companion had chicken strips and fries. I had breakfast with bacon, pancakes, and hash browns and gravy. Mine was very tasty and hit the spot. 

One drawback: My friend used the lady's room and said it was in bad shape.
author: P S.

description: This Pinecrest was a place I looked forward to during my travels to San Francisco for business. Good breakfast and service. Since they have unfairly separated with their chef, it has been going in the opposite direction. I will not be back ever. Rude and poor food quality at this point. Good luck.
author: Mr C.

description:
Tommy....Tommy.....Tommy - your family restaurant is awesome.  I love your place.  24 hour diner in the middle of Union Square San Francisco - phenomenal diner environment and great food.  I always find what I want and everything is great.  Your Reuben sandwich with pound of fries, sauerkraut and Russian dressing oozing write out of it, onto my hands, is making me day dream right now in my office.

-----

This place is great.  Close to the Westin St. Francis and other hotels in the Union Square.  Classic diner with a great crew.  Weathered booths and classic diner bar stools adorn this place.  Prices are No reservations are required.  Locals and tourists constantly frequent this place.  Very fast service and reasonable prices in the heart of the Foggy City.
author: Nick K.

description: A decent breakfast, nothing amazing, but service was all over the board. Our waitress wasn't very nice and I suspect it's the same woman who other people have complained about here. The booth in back of us had questions about their bill and she seemed so disinterested. She never checked on us once we were served, either, and quite clearly didn't care. The busboys were wonderful, though, and really made it pleasant. Regardless, there are clearly regulars here and there were lines out the door every day we walked by.
author: Katie T.

description: Every once and awhile, I like good diner food. This place is the quintessential diner and it rocks. We went for a late evening treat. The salad was fresh, crisp, and delish.  The hash browns are out of this world. We watched other food as it was served, and it all looked great. Good portions.
author: Steve S.

description: Service was very good. I liked the food, albeit I'm not very experienced on American breakfast.
author: Lucas C.

description:
Great omelet!!!! Really good hot coffee... Service was just fine.  Excellent location near Union Square. Good prices too. 

This is a classic diner, booths, bar, etc.  Friendly staff. Highly recommend their breakfast.  The omelet is large, by the way.  What more could you want?
author: Brad H.

description: Thumbs up for vegetarian options. Had the organic Malibu (veggie burger and fries), it was delish.
author: Siema M.

description: Classic diner serving classic diner fare. Outside is a little run down but don't let that turn you away. Good food, fast. Ice cream is good too.
author: Owen O.

description:
World Class Turnover!

There is nothing world famous here.  I am not so sure why they are so busy.  I guess it's location. 

The food itself was fine.  Fresh and ok, the prices are comparable to other local places.

The service was simply not there. We sat, we ordered, we ate, we paid.  

No refill of coffee, no check in about our food (although the 4 top behind us got some good treatment!).

Pass...
author: Dean P.

description:
The food here is decent. The portions are typically large, and my country fried steak was really tasty. 

The server was attentive and fast. It was the only place where we wouldn't have had to queue. I'm certainly a fan. Even my glass of wine wasn't half bad.

The only reason they lose a star is that for how busy it was, they should have had another server working. But overall the service was still good. If San Fran's prices and queues are getting you down, this is the place to come.
author: Laurie W.

description: Loved this place. Walking distance from Hotel Adagio. Servers and staff very friendly. Coffee was great. Food was great!
author: Beth E.

description: Everything was very good here but the feeling not too good by charging tip advance on bill. I understand why people do that to those customers . I went to eat so many time but only this time I brought my grandpa and got charged tip in advance. We spoke Cantonese a lot . Hey, we are not American doesn't mean we don't tip good. I always tip at least 20% of the bills。You lost some money because you took my money without having my permission . I planing to bring my family on next Thursday again but not sure I am being welcome as an Asian .
author: Iris C.

description: After moving to San Francisco, we had some breakfast at this place.  This place gets packed really fast, so be prepared to wait.  We got lucky and didn't have to.  I had the spanish omlette and my gf had the cornbeef and hash.  I'd say mine was good, but very typical for a diner.  It's nothing special and you will definitely know what you'll be getting.  So I guess it's good for those who aren't as adventurous and don't want surprises!  The cornbeef hash was OK, it wasn't crispy which is how she prefers it.  The service is excellent though, they are fast and really are there for you.  The food is just very typical!  It's much better than Lori's Diner in my opinion.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Just what you would expect of a typical diner: home -cooked food and big portions of it. Only went here for breakfast and ended up coming back because the first time I went it was so good. They didn't disappoint either time. 

If you're staying in the area and want something better and less expensive than a hotel breakfast, this is your best shot.
author: B H.

description: Was recommended this place by our hotel. Full breakfast menu and it was right around the corner. Nothing beats greasy diner food when you've had a night out drinking with your buddies. This place was good. Pretty packed when we went. Got seated at the bar after about 10 mins. They had your usual breakfast food and a couple of interesting one off items. Def worth a shot if you are in the area needing a quick meal.
author: Drew B.

description: good breakfast place in downtown. No waiting time on a Sunday, which is perfect. Fast service and good food. But it is very hot and small inside. I love their crunchy hashbrown. But for "two eggs of any style", they priced it about $9.50, which is higher than any other breakfast places that I've been.
author: Carrie Z.

description: Visited here Jan 27th 2017 with a colleague for breakfast. Asked by staff how many in our party. Advised the staff member that there was my colleague and I, but that a further colleague would be joining us within 5 mins. We were told that since only 2 of our party were currently present we would not be allocated the next available table as it seated 4. I pointed out that my other colleague was en route and would be with us within 5 mins, thereby making up our party of 3 in total. This was however, not enough reason to be allocated a 4 person table  when only the 2 of us were present. This nonsensical response came from the staff member after he asked his manager for what I can only assume was 'Guidance' in this particularly difficult mathematical conundrum. On seeing him allocate the exact same table to a different party of 2 very shortly afterwards, we decided to leave and bring our business and money elsewhere. If only the staff member had the ability to 'think outside the box.... '. Unfortunately he didn't possess that ability, which was plainly obvious.
author: Marc T.

description: Good basic diner, right in the middle of town.  Easy walk and plenty of choices.  I think it would be best for breakfast!
author: Kenneth A.

description: Finding real breakfast in the city before work early in the morning in San Francisco, California, or maybe just anywhere outside of east coast or New York seems to be kind of hard. There are no street carts or full service deli's willing to make a real egg sandwich, so you are left with no options (except maybe McDonald's, which really isn't an option for me) for a quick eat-as-you-walk breakfast. But at least the next best thing if you have extra time, is a 24-hour diner, which again are few and far between. This place is very convenient downtown, good food, and of course open 24 hours. So if it's early in the morning, or late at night after clubbing, this is where you can get some good food. And this place has been around since 1969!
author: Peter K.

description:
Good service, good food, reasonable prices. Me and my family loved it.

The staff was friendly and their bacon burger was delicious. Open 24/7 too.
author: Linus C.

description: Very bad customer service they mix everything with bacon and ham especially there hash browns and lie to you and say no!!!!! Never coming back very dirty place
author: Scott J.

description: This Diner is one of the many reasons I want to go back to San Francisco!!!! Absolutely delicious food!!!
author: Tommy R.

description: Pretty good little diner. Small and very intimate, but good greasy spoon food when you need that the most.
author: Travis Q.

description: New York steak had no flavor. Pork chops were blah... No flavor...Wouldn't order it again.
author: Nate S.

description: All I can say is Ewwww. The service was good. But the food was nasty. Everything at our table seemed liked it came from a can.  Their was a homeless dude passed out at the booth across from us.  Ughh so nasty I'm never going back I'd rather starve:O
author: Natasha P.

description:
Went to Pinecrest for breaky this morning.. sat at the bar and watched the grillman work his magic. 
This place runs like a finely oiled machine, in a tight space. 

Decor is old but speaks of many happy and fed patrons over the years. 

I had the basic 2 egg, toast, hashbrown and bacon breakfast. Nothing special, but it was made perfectly. toast was delicious, eggs and bacon prepared perfectly and hashbrowns oh so good. 

Would definitely come back here.. I haven't had all the breakfasts available in the city, obviously,but if you're looking for a good solid breakfast place, you will leave this place very satisfied.
author: Vlad R.

description: The best diner experience I have ever had. The staff was kind of slow but it was a busy night. Make sure you order something really greasy, and delicious! My first stop on my trip in San Francisco and it was a great decision to go there than to a neighboring restaurant. Loved it!!
author: E C.

description: Great place for breakfast. Typical diner with slow service and questionably clean utensils. But, what more do you expect from a diner?  Omelet was awesome. Kids pancakes were great and wife loved the French toast.
author: Douglas G.

description:
If you live in SF, you are so lucky for several reasons, and one of them is for living close to Pinecrest Diner. No joke!

I took a trip to SF for 3 nights and 4 days with my bf. We met up with some friends after checking into a hotel in Union Square. We walked up to Johnny Foley's Irish House and looked at the menu. Something about salmon on pancakes turned me off, okay well maybe the steep prices did, but whatever. We asked the bouncer where we could get some quick food and he sent us over to Pinecrest Diner (thank goodness).

Let's just say we went there that night, and for breakfast/lunch the next three days including the last day we had in SF. The food is delicious and the prices are reasonable for the location (anywhere in downtown is going to cost some money). I specifically liked the hotlinks and the Mediterranean plate (the healthier option), which I took pictures of and posted.

The service was fast, efficient, and friendly. Can't complain one bit.

My friends, my bf, and I were pretty happy with this gem. Hopefully, I'll be able to visit in the super near future. 

Pinecrest Diner, I miss your breakfast already. I mean you only started our day every day for three days.
author: Maria G.

description: Four of us stopped in around midnight and had a great breakfast. Fast service excellent food. French toast was awesome.
author: Chris J.

description:
The first time we went to the diner we really loved it, but the few times we have gone back since we have been very disappointed.  The last time we went they carried the kitchen floor mats out past our table to clean them while we were eating. Let's just say that we were done eating at that point.

Probably won't go back again.
author: Daphne W.

description:
Pinecrest is the shit, that is, the bees knees when it comes to your classic american diner. Open since the 70's i Believe? it speaks.
All of you "diner connoisseurs" ought to re-evaluate exactly what your expecting out of your meal when you choose to patronize a 24-7 diner; nice hot big kid size portions of hashbrowns, killer omellets, Frank's hot sauce (you have to ask for it), toast with lots n lots of butter, and coffee coffee coffee coffeeee for days. 
This isn't the place that you go to get your cute tiny sized portions of benedict while you pinky-up with your glass of fine white wine and shrimp cocktail. This is a goddamned classic American diner, serving classic American foods, and that to me is what I expect out of a 24-7 diner.
I live in the TL and go here all the time.
author: David S.

description:
I used to come here a lot during the year 2014. My favorite diner in the city.
It's a fast casual place that serves the greasiest, yummiest food.

The country friend steak with the white sauce reminds me of the Midwest. Crispy at every bite and juicy.

The pancakes were also good. Soft, velvety, buttery texture. 

Definitely comfort food at its finest.
author: Leslie M.

description: Absolutely delicious. Omelette with spinach and avocado, hash browns and super tasty sourdough. Short stack of pancakes to top it all off. We will be back. Maybe tomorrow!?!
author: Lisa R.

description: I was in town for a conference and wanted to meet the hubby for a quick lunch before going back. I had the tuna melt and the hubby had the reuben and onion rings. Both were very good. The restaurant is a very old diner and they have kept it that way, which gives the place a old town appeal.  If I go back I think I would want to try their breakfast menu.
author: Robin W.

description:
Just walked out of here and the experience was almost acceptable, but the old white haired man who I think was the owner just ruined the experience for us.

There were about two groups of people waiting for a table and the old fart literally was shooing us away so people can "sit and get a table." UHHH IT'S NOT MY PROBLEM THEY SHOWED UP LATER THAN MY GROUP AND IT IS DEFINITELY NOT MY PROBLEM THEY DON'T HAVE ENOUGH ROOM FOR PEOPLE. 

I ALMOST WALKED AWAY WITHOUT PAYING SINCE THE GUY WAS SHOOING US AWAY WHILE WE WERE LOOKING AT THE CHECK!!! 

Plain rude and completely unacceptable. OBVIOUSLY THERE IS NOTHING SPECIAL ABOUT THEIR FOOD EITHER. This is your typical grease diner food. 

I say steer clear, unless of course if you appreciate rudeness and being shooed away so they can maximize their profit for the day!
author: Gi V.

description: Standard diner fare, taken up a notch. Excellent preparation, quality ingredients and welcoming staff make each dish incredible. Definitely worth the wait!
author: J P.

description: Touring SF from out of state. Did the seafood, Chinese and Italian. But nothing tastes as good as a greasy dive.  More than that, the chicken Cobb salad was loaded with delicious protein and fresh avocado. And my family got a variety from the hot pastrami, fish and chips, and banana French toast (breakfast available 24/7).   I have a satisfied bunch for our last meal in SF.
author: Lori T.

description:
This place looks like one of those diners you see in movies!

Right across from our hotel so location was perfect. 

Arrived here at 8am and luckily beat the rush. We didn't have to wait for our table, but by the time we left there was LOTS of people outside waiting.

I had the country fried steak and eggs and it was good. I have yet to stumble across a diner with food that really wows me so yeah. The sauce was a little on the salty side, but still good nonetheless. Steak and eggs came with 2 slices of toast and hash browns so it was a really big breakfast for me.

My friend had the vegetarian sandwich with pesto cream sauce and she enjoyed it. She was full after half because it was quite large.

Total was $23 with tip

I'd probably come back since it's a convenient nice little joint and the food is not bad at all :)
author: Joanne C.

description: If you are looking for a mom and pop diner that makes good food and provides large portions then go here. You will leave satisfied and you will be full. The service is good and prices are reasonable. You may have to wait for a table depending on the time of day you go. We started up a conversation with our server and she was a happy employee that had worked for the family along time and spoke highly of the family that owned the business. If you go you won't be disappointed.
author: Jeff M.

description: There's a lot of competition for diners in the downtown SF area.  Pinecrest is hands down the best.
author: Ray A.

description: The best mozzarella sticks I have ever had. The staff are a little quiet (it was 3am though so I can see why), but goodness gracious do they make amazing food. Honestly the best diner food I think I'll have for a long time.
author: Chelsea K.

description: Honestly I wanted to give one star... But the owner saved the experience, so for that.. Three stars . My fiancé and I ordered an omelette , he ordered an OJ and I ordered a coffee as well. His OJ came and my coffee was no where to be seen. I'm kind of that person that needs coffee in the morning but server never came back . Our food came, still no coffee .. Needed a refill on water, never happened. My fiancé liked his omelette but mine had wayyyyy too much cheese that I couldn't eat it . The hash browns were amazing and cooked perfect though. The check came and my coffee.. Great . Server never asked us how anything was so I would go with we really didn't have any service ... Owner chatted with us for a few and apologized. He was super nice and clearly cared about his restaurant but because of the influx on minimum wage couldn't hire better help. Probably won't return.
author: Jennifer J.

description: Excellent service. Very good tuna melt. A diner that could have been in a Dashell Hammet novel. Not too many of these kind of greasy spoons around anymore. Film noir atmosphere. :)
author: Karen F.

description:
Somehow ended up here twice within a week for brunch. 

This is just your basic, reliable, 24 hour diner. Solid service and food. I had the vegetarian omelette and the farmers omelette. I could never finish both times. The food comes out really fast and theres an open kitchen if you want to watch your food being cooked. 

Prices are decent, I think the sides are a little overpriced though. I think it was like $3.50 for one egg. Free refills on iced tea and coffee. I didn't think the food was too greasy and I'm sure I'll find myself back here soon enough. Its near Powell St. Bart and there has never been a wait for me but I hear it does it packed.
author: Tiffany V.

description: It's a diner. My husbands egg omelet was really, really greasy. My waffle was pretty good. The wait staff was really friendly and the food came out quick.
author: Hana H.

description: First Ill start off with the quality of food which is good(not a must have),but unfortunately the process of what took place before I got my food was disappointing. Customer service is non existent if you're not dining in I assumed since I was not greeted which is fine its a lot going on a lot of people not just me I get that but when I then take that in consideration and greet the employee "how are you this evening " no reply and im literally less than a foot away from her,fine no problem maybe they arent sociable or maybe even shy, no biggie but then i was left at the order register for 15mins unattended no one asked if i were helped nothing, or assisted. until finally one of the kitchen crew members were forced to assist me due to the negligence of the other employees didnt feel valued or appreciated at all. Unfortunately this isnt a one time thing I was hoping that was a bad day but yet again I got subpar or any service at all. 24hrs is convenient yes but if this is going to be the price to pay ill seek breakfast elsewhere and suggest the same if you decide to try them out. And I was referred with high regards.
author: Ben W.

description:
This is one of those places where it takes you back in time. I always try to go here at least once while I am in SF. The food is diner style fair and the portions are big while not getting too expensive (for SF).

I like being able to sit in a  booth and watch the traffic go by. The food is really good; haven't had a bad meal yet. Only issue I have is the only restroom they have is down stairs and down the corridor. Otherwise a very good place to get breakfast, lunch or a really late dinner (they're open 24 hrs).
author: Wayne C.

description: My family and I stayed across the street at Hotel G and saw this from our 9th floor suite. I took my son and daughter there for breakfast the first morning we arrived in the city and we were not disappointed! The place is cozy and busy, the staff is very friendly and attentive and most important, the food was good. We ordered simple: Eggs and bacon for me and my daughter and my son ordered one of the specials. The food came out pretty quickly and it was delicious. When we go back to visit Frisco, we will definitely be visiting this diner again. Yum!
author: Magun S.

description:
Are you the person that want the gratuity hidden on the hand scribbled check, already included on your card, and when you question this practice, enjoy a flaming scalding by the owner? Do you enjoy mediocre food, sticky floors and greasy tables?

Then this is the place you should go to!
author: Olle S.

description: I have to be honest. I was forced to go here by a tourist staying at the Hilton. I was skeptical. But this was an honest to goodness East Coast style diner. My bacon omelet w mushrooms and American cheese (sub tomato for avocado) was perfectly cooked as well. I liked how they called it "low cal." So, was very pleasantly surprised!
author: Andrew K.

description: Came here for breakfast, a bit pricey at 14 bucks for eggs, bacon, sausage (undercooked) and pancakes. The wife had eggs, toast and hash browns for 10 bucks and she actually got more food than I did. Lesson learned, get the hash browns, they're really good. Plus they charged 5 bucks for two cups of coffee, which seems a bit steep. On the plus side very fast service and the staff seemed on point.
author: James T.

description: Service very attentive good teamwork. Fast delivery, yummy food and value for money. We had the onion rings mozz sticks and chicken tenders. Crunchy yet fresh delicious inside. The clam chowder is also delicious and satisfying..a bit heavy on the cream so very filling. The beef mac is exactly what it should be and the bill was surprisingly low. We will return.
author: Hugh M.

description: When it comes to 24/7 dining pinecrest definitely does the job. Good portions, good food and fast service especially when you are around late at night. Nothing beats a plate of hot food whenever you want it.
author: Bobby V.

description: I went there to go study and was quite clear of my intentions.  I needed coffee to stay awake.  They have small cups, from the 60's that need to filled up repeatedly.  I got 3 refills and then had to ask for a 4th and then they just didn't seem to care anymore.   I also ordered the macaroni.  Chicken/spinach.  Wasn't my favorite.  I took it home and added some seasoning to it to be able to eat it.
author: Amanda H.

description: In my top 3 diner experiences, ever. Don't let the classic diner decor scare you away. Great food, fast service.
author: Carmen F.

description:
A great place to grab a bite with friends after a night of clubbing!

Conveniently located right by Ruby Skye & Slide, this friendly diner is only a few stumbles away from the night establishments. Now even a drunk girl in stilettos can make this journey. 

Very sweet staff & greasy American fast food...what else can you ask from a 24-hr diner?
author: Nina M.

description:
Great burger! Went there for the first time with some co-workers since, we moved down the street. The service is good (basic). The food was surprisingly good. I ordered a bacon cheese burger with an egg. 

It was really good! I think I licked the plate clean. Great spot since, its 24 hours. I cant wait to have their breakfast!
author: Ralph M.

description:
Perfect dinner after a show. I saw a lot of theater-goers lining up here, so we took a walk around Union Square first, and by the time we returned most people had been seated & served, so we didn't have to wait long.

Service was a bit slow as other reviewers have noted, but the portions were generous. Note that there is a $7 per person minimum, and a $7 charge for splitting plates.

Steak sandwich: Asked for medium-rare, received medium-well (barely any pink.) The steak came with some lettuce, tomato, and a delicious mushroom/onion/cheese sautee. The sandwich came with a side of super garlicky fries. Overall, glad we didn't order an actual steak; any restaurant that can't get their steak temperatures right simply shouldn't serve it.

Cobb salad: Ordered based on the server's recommendation - a juicy grilled chicken breast over a bed of fresh crispy mixed greens, generous portions of fresh crumbled bacon and generous portions of bleu cheese, with cherry tomatoes, sliced avocados, and a hard-boiled egg on the side. I wasn't a fan of the dressing though, and was glad I asked for it on the side.

Overall, solid diner experience after a night at the theater and a walk around Union Square taking pictures of the Christmas tree.
author: Linda F.

description: It's OK like the review suggest, because while food is decent.
author: Monica S.

description:
Okay I'm not much of a diner person, nor am I much of an onion rings kinda guy. But some of us were hungry after clubbing down the street at Slide. Some of us weren't so hungry and were just chillin' while the others eat. 

They have a $7 minimum per person, but since we were in a huge gropu and weren't all hungry, the waiter was really chill about it and let it slide. My table ended up getting two orders of onion rings and french toast (which they messed up and gave us pancakes...), bacon & eggs. Remember how I said I wasn't an onion rings kinda guy? Well damn, these are some of the best onion rings I've ever tasted! I don't know if it was the drunchies or what but they were deeeee-licious! I was really amazed how they were onion rings without an actual piece of onion in them!

You know what else comes with drinking? The need to pee. Their bathroom waaay downstairs is really clean. You can take a leak without feeling all grossed out...props!

Anyway, back to the food. The food is pretty pricey (we spent $25ish on 2 orders of onion rings and the bacon/eggs/french toast dish), but damn if you're clubbing at Ruby Skye or Slide or whatever is nearby and you're drunk and looking for good food...you got Pinecrest Diner right there for ya. Price doesn't matter when you're drunk...just good food!
author: Henry T.

description:
Service is terrible. No one looks happy to be there and the food is okay.
The Scrambled eggs are good, sausage and bacon are average, the french toast tasted like they cooked it on the same cooking surface they make their hamburgers...gross.
author: Neuy D.

description:
I love and hate this place. 

I have spent a few cross faded nights eating here with friends, while witnessing bums strolling in or drunk club hoes doing what they do best, yelling and trying to start a fight in a diner.. 

I originally gave two stars but remembering the entertainment set up by Ruby Skye goers, I decided to to add a star. 

Also, the food isn't totally bad, just mediocre. Then again, if you go here at night, not sober, it'll taste great. I do enjoy their veggie burger with fries! 

During the day, it can be quite packed, so waiting may occur.
author: K N.

description:
Have been going there since last three years .....and they had the best eggs I felt.
Of late I feel they have gone down on the quality of food provided -the service always sucked still.......
The pinecrest special omelette now have more mushroom and tomato and less meat and the hash brown are burnt as if they are cooked in hurry .........
Understand that few slips here and there happens but few more tries and if it's same story maybe it's time to try some other place ..........
author: Ajay M.

description: I would only ever consider going here after a long night at Ruby Skye. That being said... It serves it's purpose well.
author: Sam J.

description:
It's awesome to come here after a night of drinking. There was a fight outside last night. So a show came with the meal. Otherwise, the food is typical diner stuff. Kind of like Denny's. I had the steak and eggs. My friend had a waffle and sausage. The bill was $31.
I'd come here if it's 3 am. Otherwise, I won't be eating here again.
author: Calvin M.

description:
My wife and I were looking for a quick bite to eat on a Friday night. We were waiting for some family to fly in for a wedding and all their flights got delayed so we were left to find somewhere to eat dinner just the two of us. We were staying nearby and since we had a long day of walking through what felt like every hill in San Francisco we wanted something quick and good. The concierge recommended Pinecrust. We showed up around 9pm and it wasn't that crowded. I'm thinking it was between the regular dinner crowd and drunk crowd so we sat right away. My wife ordered a Mexican salad and I the Reuben. Her salad was solid for being from a diner. My Reuben, might be one of the best I've ever had. The meat was great and they sure didnt skimp out on pulling it on. We both were in the mood for shakes so we both got chocolate shakes. We probably could have shared one, but we were hungry enough to finish our own. I'd personally go back again just to have the Reuben. I can't talk to any other item on the menu but solid food for what we ordered and the staff and what I assume was the manager was super friendly. Well don't Pinecrust.

Only reason I give them a 4 and not a 5 is cause for a diner its a lil pricey, but that also might be a product of being in prime San Francisco location. So don't let +/- a few dollar steer you away.
author: Saba H.

description:
I woke up at 4 am and was starving. Got out the smart phone and checked google maps for 24 hour diner and this was the closest one to where I was staying.

Coffee strong real stuff.

Food arrived so fast my head spun - I ordered what I call a kitchen sink omelet which means it's got veggies, meat, cheese. OMG it looked like it was made with 6 eggs. TOAST THEY ACTUALLY BUTTER THE TOAST HERE!!!! IT'S NOT DRIPPED ON WITH AN EYE DROPPER WOW. If I was impressed by the toast well jeezus. Hash browns - again a HUGE portion perfectly cooked.

Of course there are the snotty o I live here so it's snot reviews. Ignore them if you like the basic big assed old diner - not ersatz fake old diner - breakfast. I used to live in SF too - stop with the elitist bullshit. Not everyone wants a steel cut oatmeal gag me gruel or organic quail egg frittata tofu pile of shit for breakfast. God get over yourselves. 

BTW it was so huge I couldn't finish it but they didn't rush my ass out when I just felt like having another cup of joe. Thank you Pinecrest Diner.
author: Chuck F.

description: Really good food. My husband and I shared the pork chop breakfast which was perfect for the 2 of us (and we're fatties!).  Hash browns were nice and crispy (nothing I hate more than soggy, raw hash browns).  They don't do poached or boiled eggs which was a disappointment to my husband who is the 1 in 1000 people who prefers their eggs poached.  My teenage son had the steak breakfast... He's a big kid and ate most of what was on his plate.  Maybe bit pricey; $50 for 2 breakfast, 2 juices and 2 coffees.  We'd Come back.
author: Nichole M.

description: Good food and affordable prices for what's available around downtown. My husband an I both got a burger and they were really delicious. We ordered a hot dog for our toddler and it was HUGE!
author: Miranda E.

description:
You ever go into a place while walking around town but you're not that hungry and you have no idea what you want to eat? That just happened to me. And to my surprise I found THE best-tasting Ruben sandwich ever!

The corned beef was sliced so thin it was almost transparent AND it was not overly salty BUT they pile it on so high with gobs of melty swiss cheese, saurkraut and the perfect amount of thousand island, that I had to cut my sandwich into quarters and eat it with a fork! I've NEVER eaten a sandwich with a fork....just writing about this right now, my mouth is starting to water all over again. Asked for extra crispy fries and they were perfectly done to compliment each bite of that luscious sandwich!
author: Carmen M.

description:
Let's start with the good points.
1. It's open 24 hours.
2. ..
3. ...
Actually, I don't really remember the rest..  When you've been out drinking all night and you're suddenly feeling hungry, you don't have a lot of options.  Any restaurant open at those hours where you can sober up a bit is good enough.
author: Abraham P.

description: Word to the wise.  While sitting at the counter, I was watching the cook handle raw beef patties and raw bacon with bare hands and then picking up the chocolate chips for chocolate chip pancakes.  No hand wasing necessary since that would be a hassle.  Forget about gloves or basic sanitation.  Diner beware.
author: Mitch W.

description: Great service and terrific food.  Our coffee was never empty and the food came very quickly.  For such a full place, we had hardly a wait for a table.  They can get people in and out efficiently without feeling rushed.  Their corned beef has was prepared perfectly and have wonderful pancakes served with lots of butter and warm syrup.  Definitely a great place for breakfast to start the day.  Their sign states, "The best breakfast in  San Francisco."  I would say they lived up to that claim.  We will most likely come here again when we visit.
